text: pretty awesome place.  A lot to do and it's good for adults and kids.  My son, wife and I went to hang out with friends and had a blast.  Bowled the best game of my life!  130!! haha

Second time coming here and it was so much fun! Ryan was the best bartender and was so friendly! Will definitely be looking for him next time we come back! His drinks were on point and he took great care of us! Bowling was fun as always and playing laser tag was the highlight! Fun run in around while having a great time!

Very good local place for a family night out with a mixture of food, beverage, bowling, arcade, and laser tag. Hard to drag my son out of here and only issue is I don't see this as a competitive bowling alley. Now a days the alleys are trying attract as much attention as possible so it makes sense but true bowlers may want to go somewhere else while I feel this is more of a family fun night out. I still give 5 stars as I realize I am giving the cranky old man review, Get Off My Lawn!, as Uptown does bring a nice change to Surprise for all families.

So disappointed in their specials. So anytime they "advertise" a special you have to ask for this specifically. For example, Sundays they have their Red Zone special! Well you better ask for this, otherwise you will spend twice this amount on bowling. I was told the employees are not allowed to advertise this, you have to find out by the advertisements in the establishment or online. 

I have been disappointed in the time it takes to get service around the establishment , unless you go to the bar. I have been visiting uptown alley since they opened. It's close to home, they show sports on the big screens and all around the place. 

Don't be in hurry when you go for dinner. We asked for a Coke 3 times and we never got it. 

The manager did offer a discount on our food so that was nice. However I am all about customer service and would have preferred great customer service vs the service we received.
Good "all in one spot" for eating, bowling, and playing arcade games... even picking up a drink from one of the bars. Movie theater is close by as well.

Went bowling today for my son's birthday and was disappointed that they refused to acknowledge his birthday. The counter attendant told me they could, then after discussing it with her co-worker she said no. Bowling alleys are pretty popular places to have parties - you'd think they'd want to make it a pleasant experience. Won't be celebrating here again.

Can I give zero stars? Hours of operation on the website and door say open at 8 am on Saturday. Well it is 9:15 am and I am standing outside with my husband and kids and the doors are locked. I saw a man inside so I knocked, he motioned to me that it would be a minute. 5 minutes later and no one has come to the door. First time coming here and it is now my last. What a shame.

Wow!  Happy hour wings are the best!  Nachos portion is huge and great price for what you get.  You may need to keep on your server cause it's a little hectic in there but happy hour is the way to go here... My kids love the lazer tag and video games!  Not bad for little Surprise ;)

Don't expect the waitresses to be quick.  Ours was very slow.

We bowled here early Saturday afternoon. No problem getting a lane, but when we left, the line was almost out the door. 

When we arrived, there was a line and only one cashier, you would think on a Saturday that they would have more staff at the register and less at the shoe return counter. The drinks were a little pricey, but it was a fun place especially when this is one of the very few attractions out in Surprise.

This place is like a dave and busters on steroids, like a costco size building but has a bowling alley, restaurant, VIP bowling area with pool tables, they have nice furniture, HUGE tvs, good background music half the time.  One time I came in and they were playing stupid 80s music.

I've been here 3 times now and every experience with the food has been very good.  Their appetizers are half off in the afternoons and considering the taste/cost ratio during happy hour you can't beat it. However, I wouldn't ever pay full price for their appetizers. The beer is half off too, you can't beat a pint of beer on tap for $2 with some excellent wings. This is the best thing that happened to surprise since Buffalo wild wings shut its doors. This place would be great for a work party or birthday party.

This place puts AMF and brunswick bowling alleys to shame. This is the only place to go to for fun in surprise, you'd have to go further beyond surprise to do some clubbing/bar scene. This isn't the place for that. 

It gets 4 starts because they lack something hugely fundamental. They have a descent range of drinks to choose from, nice furniture, but did not seclude the adult bar/vip room enough away from the kids. the adult bar area is very small but nice and is open with kids running and screaming by. 

The vip room has djs and music/sometimes even live music which is okay.

The bottom line: Overall, if you're looking for a friday night to chill with your bros or your girlfriends, and looking to do something different go for the appetizers half off before 7, and drinks are half off too this is a great place to hangout, if you're looking to do something entertaining and not in the mood for going to a full on bar.

Currently at uptown as I write this review. Came from California to attend a friends wedding. While killing time waiting for our suits to be altered we thought we would kill time and go bowling. Upon arrival we we met by Jim. He helped us with laser tag and once we exited he had brought us waters. He also told us about the current deals and helped us with getting a lane and shows to bowl. Simple gestures but made the experience worth it. Customer service is key and Jim has great customer service.

What a cool place! I was hesitant in going at first.  However, my hesitation was almost immediately put to ease!  From the moment we walked in we were met with smiles and wonderful customer service. Not to mention the great interior design of the place.  We had a delicious dinner accompanied by tasty drinks (the bar tender definitely was not stingy on the alcohol) and with happy hour prices all night long our wallets weren't hurting either.  After dinner we spent the rest of the evening in the VIP lounge.  It was really busy with lots of younger kids, so it was nice to have a separate, more quite area to bowl and hang out.  I would absolutely recommend going to Uptown Alley and look forward to my next visit!!

This place is awesome to hangout with friends/family/dates! Ryan G. made it super fun and we want to come back again! He gave us great info and was nice enough to let us know of the 2 dollar Tuesday specials they have here!  Thanks for a fun night Ryan G.!

I have been going to the uptown alley for a few years.  There are two people that have always gone above and beyond to make each time a great experience. One is our bartender Claudia.  She has always been extremely friendly, fast and efficient.  THANKS CLAUDIA. The other person who goes out of his way to give great service is Jason in the bowling area. He always gives great customer service and makes it a fun bowling experience.  THANKS JASON. Our family truly appreciates all you do

Best bowling alley ive ever been too. For a bowling alley they get 5 stars plus they have some pretty amazing food. They also have servers for the bowling floor which is neat not having to go up to some bar every time you want a beer. Big tvs everywhere and nice draft selection. The order of wings you get is huge and there are like 3 bars.

Love  this place! It has a restaurant /bar 
( red embers)  to the left when you walk in. To the right are the arcade games and laser tag..walk straight through and you get to the bowling alley that glows in the dark, to the right of that is a 21 and over bar/bowling alley with couches and High top tables ect... There's also another bar just outside that tucked between the bowling alley and arcade.. Food  is always  amazing.. my favorite is the chicken and vegetables... It has  grilled chicken, asparagus, artichoke hearts , red and green peppers,onion and lots of yumminess. ..... Bonus  for me is that there is karoake with a live band on Thursday nights .amazing sound system and the host is a favorite local entertainer/singer that makes it extra fun. Yes... I love this place!
Uptown Alley is a great place but my food was served cold ...all 3 dishes.  Not happy about that
Great fun. Great food. Outstanding service. Tyler and the entire staff crew were first class, and they keep the whole facility in very nice condition. Well done!

Probably one of the best places in the valley to bring the kids and watch a football game.   The kids can play laser tag, video games and bowling while you enjoy the game on humongous projection screen. Good service and decent food.

This place reminds me of Vegas! Except without slot machines lol. When you walk in the lights are shining and the games are playing from the arcade. 

Very kid friendly and let me tell you, they are running a mock! I sat at the bar and was greeted promptly, I ordered a Rouge Dead Guy Ale (one of my favorites) and enjoyed the hockey game playing. After my second beer I decided to order. 

The bartender guided me around the menu and I started with the egg rolls which were very tasty with the sauce. I then ordered the spicy bacon burger (with the mango habanero sauce on the side). Once the burger arrived I was thanking myself for putting that sauce on the side. Holy cow was it SPICY! The burger tasted fresh and was very impressive! The bartender continued to check on me and made me feel very welcome. 

I gotta say, I will be back here again!

Location was accommodating. Service was horrible!! Food was mediocre at best. Managers are never around. Over priced for really poor service!!!  We waited 45 minutes for our pizza and one hour for chicken strips!! Never going back!

The waitress had made a mistake with the bill. No big deal right? Or at least I thought. Instead of asking us to pay the difference the manager tried to have us pay the entire bill again and said the first bill would credit back in 3days. I explained that would not work but they kept pushing to pay two tabs over 150$. At that point I checked my account and found a separate charge for another 25$. When I asked them to explain the charge and provide a receipt, the manager said it was just an accident and could not provide proof or reason for the charge and just said we will credit it back. So after they mess up the bill and "accidentally"  charging another 25$ the only concern they had was to get the 45$ they messed up on the bill. As I tried to get more info as to how this happened, the manager exact words to me were you're not in the right state of mind for him to explain. They tried to steal 25$ and his answer was to insult me. This is a shady business and you should be careful giving them credit/debit cards especially with large kids parties like we did. Obviously they see this as an opportunity to exploit and cheat there customers. I personally will never attend this Establishment again

Im so glad this place opened up so close to my house! It has bowling, lazer tag, a good arcade, pool, darts and more. Its a super fun place. Its pretty clean, very modern and just a nice place to chill and relax. 

Cons- Need more pool tables. 
The dont allow inside food or drinks in which is SUPER annoying.
The polices are just to strick. 

But overall i think uptown alley is an awesome place for anyone. Im so glad it came to surprise :)

Uptown Alley is a great and fun place! But when it comes to service it isn't that good. We ordered some wings and we weren't sure how much came whit them so we asked the waiter and he said it comes with eight. When we got it there was only four! It was ether they messed up the order or the sever didn't know what he was talking about!
Our first time to the Red Embers Bar & Grill. We were looking for a cold beer, and got much more. Great burgers, great service from our server, Forest. We had a great time. We will be going back.
A very fun place. Food is very good and the service is great. The bowling is very fun, if a bit pricey. The arcade is also fun for the whole family.
I'm not a huge fan of the food BUT I've been going here for the past two years.. what keeps me going back is the bartender CLAUDIA! She's fast, friendly, efficient and always has a smile on her face.
Their appetizer prices are getting as high as main course meals and the happy hour menu keeps shrinking. Bring lots of money it goes fast here.

This place is hopping with a great night life atmosphere and even private area for adults only if you want to get away from the kids for a while. The best place to watch any sports with that JUMBO screen.  I'm not much of a bowler but the gaming and luve bands are awesome.  Thanks for the good times.

-Food:  Awful.  There is nothing positive about the food.
-Service: Problematic.  Waiter not very knowledgeable of activity wait times and his food suggestions were lousy.  The wait to get someones attention just to put my name on a list for bowling was ridiculous.  Not sure who was running the front counter.
-Bowling: 3 hour wait.  Found another bowling alley in the West Valley.

I was incredibly disappointed with my first experience at Uptown Alley.  I might try again in a year or two...maybe for my kid's birthday.  

Having the bowling wait time posted or, at least, let the waiting staff know so they can encourage the diners to put their name on a list would have been helpful.  Our waiter had no clue about the wait time.  

Hopefully their problems can be sorted out.

Went here in a last minute whim on a Saturday night. The bartender was nice but they definitely need more help back there! I waited super long and the drink was ok. We bowled a few games and the waitress we had was good but again this establishment needs way more help! They had a live band playing and they were phenomenal! Will try to check them out again and see how the service is.

I regularly bowl in Sun City West but our lanes are closed for maintenance so I decided to check out Uptown Bowl. Big mistake to try and practice on a weekend. First, it was very crowded so I went into the lounge area (21+) and there were lanes available. Very nice for a party but not a good way to get your practice in. Lanes are dark so hard to see your mark and the screen reflect on the lane. But in was very nice in there. Great place for a date night! Drink was tasty but a little over-priced.

The regular lanes looked good but, again, the reflection from the big screens could mess up your bowling. Looks like a great place for families. Not sure what the crowd would be like during the weekday. 

All in all, didn't love it nor was it a bad experience. Next weekend I will get my practice in at a more traditional bowling center.
I order some soft pretzels and they were anything but soft.  Apparently they don't care how their food goes out.
Nice Spot for entertainment Bowling , Food and Drinks service seemed to be quick and professional. I plan to revisit again

Rating the Restuarant at the Uptown Alley only. Went there during midday, about 2 pm. Service was very good. Drinks were filled quickly. Servers were very friendly. Appetizer came out with the meal, but both tasted delicious. My main reason for dropping a star was for the quantity of food compared to the price. $16-18 a plate and not a lot was delivered. We ordered the dinner salads and chips and guacamole. The quality of the food was excellent. Overall I'd say you are paying for what amounts to servings half of what you could get at a place like Red Robin or Chili's. The atmosphere and service are excellent.

This place tries to cram too much under one roof and they don't do any of it well. If you want to bowl go to a bowling alley. If you want to eat go to restaurant. If you want video games go to game works or castles and coasters.  If you want to pay too much money to do all of that under one roof then come here.

My husband and I thought we would check this place out on one of date nights. We went on a Saturday night so it was pretty packed. We walked in and saw a band playing. Acoustics were terrible. Couldn't make out at all what the band was playing but I'm guessing that it was bad 90's music. Once we squeezed ourselves through the crowd to see what we could do we saw that it was a pretty big place with screaming kids running all over. Tried to get a lane to bowl on. Was told that it going to be OVER a hour wait. Ok, that's fine. Its a Saturday night we figured, so we went to the bar to get a drink. Took forever just to get the bartender's attention and the bar area only have 5-7 people in there! Once I did get their attention I asked them to make a drink, but they didn't have apple schnapps to make it with. Okay, well I was just about to order another drink when the woman WALKS AWAY to go talk to the other bartender there! Just WOW. That was it. And I wasn't about to try to wait another 10 minutes just to get their attention again while they had their personal conversation. So we walked out of the bar DRINKLESS. We left right after that. Maybe we just didn't go on a good day, but we were pretty disappointed by the whole thing.

Our service was very good. We ordered a hamburger pizza and they were delicious. Our server had great customer service. They didn't screw up one of our orders. She removed it from  our ticket. We told her that was not necessary we ate them and we would still pay for. She brought us the correct order. This really is good customer service. I thought the games were expensive but the kids enjoyed themselves. It was clean and it was friendly. We would go back again thank you uptown alley for having a clean place and people with great customer service.
Best place to hang out. Fun bowling and laser tag for the kids. Yummy, yummy food, and some interesting beers on tap 10/10 would recommend.

I've been waiting for something like this to come to surprise and was real excited to take the family and friends there when it opened.  Went a few days before the actual grand opening and had a good time, but my mood instantly changed when I went out to get something in my truck and came inside to a "bouncer" telling me they were at capacity.  When i told him i had family in there he made me seem like a liar, and he wanted me to call my girlfriend to come to the front just so I could go back in, not a good way to start your business.  

So I thought what the heck lets try it again another weekend, so last weekend I went with some other family to show them how nice it was, I mean they have TV's everywhere an awesome arcade, and even have a 21 and older section for after 8pm that has its own lanes, bar, pool table and DJ booth for the weekends, and it doesn't cost any extra which is kind of cool.  First thing when we walked through the door was another "bouncer" telling me they were at capacity and they had a 2 hour wait, when clearly i could see from the door there was open seating EVERYWHERE and there were many open lanes.  After about 15 mins of waiting in line I asked the lady if I could use the restroom, she told me I could go next door to the movie theatre and use there's because she didn't trust me that I would come back from theirs.  AWESOME SERVICE!!! (sarcastically speaking)! 

I would give this place more stars but the service and people are terrible!! The food was good and bowling was a little overpriced but your paying for luxury pretty much.  

If they wanna stay in business they need to work on their customer service...ALOT... maybe start by getting rid of the stupid "were at capacity" thing when your not even close to it! 

I'll probably wait a while before I go back

Went here for the first time ever.
Was impressed with everything. Customer service was amazing as staff interacted with us to assure we were taken care of throughout our stay.
Bowling, darts, pool, video games, live band, multiple large screen tv's and a restaurant.
Nice place.

My boyfriend and I have been to this location before quite a few times with ok results. The last couple of time we have had some problems. The Uptown alley website tells you about these amazing bowling deals from 10pm - close you can bowl with shoes for $10 on Thursdays. That's great lets go do that.. Oh wait you have to be over 21 to get into the premises after 10 pm, It doesn't say anywhere near the deals anything about this age restriction, You have to hunt for it at the bottom of the page in the smallest writing they have on the whole website. We tend to go to other bowling alleys now, The music is always extremely loud and the screens above the lanes are usually playing sports on most of them, Not music videos or something worth watching. Wanna watch the game? Go watch it in the bar area with all the other fans.

Went bowling there for the first time Sat night.  We were charged $51 for 1 hour of bowling and two pair of shoe rentals.  A bit excessive in my mind.  They do not allow you to pay by the game after 6PM  WTF.  Our ball return jammed about half way through our time, It took at least 5 min to unjam.  We did not receive any extra time to finish our games.  Music was much tooo loud.  We prob will not be returning.
Best place for a date or for family day! I love it here! The food is awesome and the people are always so nice!

The food is decent but A little pricey. The bowling is good and it's a nice environment but they need to update their shoes. My kids had shoes That was either too tight or too loose because the Velcro are all worn out.

We had a mid afternoon bowling trip here because we were in town for a funeral and our server Jayme was awesome!!! We needed to release some stress and from the moment we walked in she directed us to a lane that we could be some what alone and was very prompt with or order. Also our drinks were never empty, she was always there at the right moment to see what else we needed. We plan on coming again when we're in town.

My kids always have fun here. We have had planned parties and they always are amazing. They value military and have special events and pricing. This place is fun for adults and kids and is a monthly staple for my family.

My husband and I have been coming here for a little while now and we love their happy hour. Well drinks and select drafts are $2 along with half price appetizers. The bartenders are pretty awesome and pour some strong drinks.

We have had most of their appetizers. Our favorites would have to be: meatball sliders, turkey/bacon sliders, southwest rolls and cheese curds. I personally have never had real cheese curds so I'm sure they don't taste like what most people are used to but I love them. Then again who doesn't love fried cheese?

First time in tonight! Greeted by nice hostess and seated quickly at a booth next to the bubble wall! Yes a bubble wall! It's neat it changes colors the kids loved it. They have a good happy hour menu Monday - Friday. DJ night is Friday Saturday nights. The regular menu had a variety of food wings to burgers to salads something for everyone. Our server Tori greeted us right away and got our drinks quickly. I order the Cobb Chicken Salad with the balsamic dressing. My husband got the Cheese burger sliders (server offered it as happy hour price which came with fries vs no fries which was a better price so good for her for giving her guests better options) all the employee working hard. Angel was busy getting heaters going carrying  trays of food just really working hard it's nice to see employees working and not just standing around. As a restaurant manger when I dine out I always admire employees working hard vs leaning hard. Our food tasted great food was hot my salad was cold and crisp. After dinner we headed over to the arcade part! The fun part! If your a first timer you pay $1 activation fee for your gamer card but it gives you 5 credits. They have various packages that gives you credits. Their prize area is reasonable for the amount of tickets you earn. We didn't do everything Uptown alley has to offer like Laser Tag and Bowling but we look forward to coming back and blowing a few games and shooting it up in the laser tag room. You should be proud of your staff and give a shout out to Angel ,Tori and your hostesses for making our experience great. See ya next time Uptown!
This place is beautiful and family friendly! However service is really slow and prices are steep. It's a nice place to go every once in a while or for a birthday.

Wow the place is huge, pricey but set up is legit and clearly bowling and laser tag are taking new leaps for the west valley. This place has arcades, live bands, laser tags and of course the bowling lanes.  I am not much of a bowler but the lanes are really nice and there is a designated area for all ages and then there are those for the adults.  This is really nice for the adults because you can have a great bar to yourself and the food is very good.  We ordered pizza's, wings, and mozzarella sticks which all were very good for a bowling shop.  

For those businesses looking for a conference room, they have them.  I have not looked into pricing because my office is so far from this place, but I will share they seem very state of the art and are large enough for a good size group.

Been to Uptown Alley about half a dozen times so far.  Several times meeting up with a small group of friends, and a couple times on a date night with my husband.  

WELL...cannot speak on the bowling alley part since we haven't been able to get into a lane due to the wait times.  But on the upside, we were able to get some good food and enjoy the company.  

Highly recommend this as more of a "grown up" place to hang out if you want to eat too....there are LOTS of people there on any given night and food choices can get expensive (in addition to shelling out for video games) for kids (ours are 19, 15, 14 and 9).  

Our favorite night to go is Thursday nights.  From 1500 (3 pm) until 11 they have HALF-PRICED appetizers and $2 domestic drafts.  My husband and I stopped in twice on thursday nights and had amazing service, not as busy as "usual" and we ordered (3) of their tasty appetizers and a couple beers a piece.  It came out to $26...WOW!  THe food was hot, fast and fresh.  Bartender (Claudia) was very friendly and attentive.  

We watched pre-season game on their wall of tvs and had a really nice date night (within a tight budget this is awesome!)  NOTE: Thursday night is also Karaoke night which is cool if that's what you're there for, but you can hear the singing (howling in some cases) in the entire building so it kinda put a damper on trying to watch the game and catch whatever Olympics events we could see.....BUT we did hav a blast overall and it didn't dent the wallet! lol

Only negatives I see at this point are: limited and expensive food options for kids, forever waiting line for bowling (a bummer if that's what you came there for)---will have to update when I take the kids in for video games and paintball.....

Overall, a great place to hangout with friends or honey for a drink and a quick meal.....WE plan on being regulars (on thursdays)....especially after checking out a movie on date night!

I Love uptown Especially Miss Makaela. She seams so dedicated to her work, always is on fleek, and hardly ever see her not smiling . She is the reason i keep coming back . Well that bartender claudia is fantastic also . She always makes my drinks just right :)
Food seemed very good. Drinks came quickly and were good. It's very loud - but it is in a bowling alley so to be expected. Good place for late nights in Surprise.

Great place to have fun. My one complaint is that waitress rather clean off tables than take ur drink order. Telling me to wait. When did it become ok to ignore or put cleaning a table before a paying customer? Priorities are all wrong. I blame the mangers because it's lack of training. Can't expect $8.00 an hour gal to have common sense or courtesy. Hope this review gets to management and correct this issue ASAP!

I don't leave reviews often but I received exceptional customer service from Jessica so I must share my experience. 

My family and I went to Uptown Alley for dinner and drinks. After being seated by the hostess, we were a little upset that a server had not come over yet to take our order. After about 15 minutes of waiting, we decided to move to a booth closer to the bar section, assuming service would be better there than the section we were originally seated at, which was all the way in the back of the restaurant. 

After 5 more minutes of impatiently waiting, I went up to the bar and was greeted by the bartender Jessica. I told her what had happened and she sincerely apologized and assured me that she will be taking care of us the remainder of the night. She promptly brought us our orders and was very tentative and friendly checking up on us very often. We were beyond impressed and pleased with her amazing customer service. She changed our entire experience and we will very likely be dining there again soon. Thank you Jessica!

My wife and I went here to grab a quick lunch before a movie. The poor bartender/waitress was slammed, but as soon as she saw us, she came over, took our drink order and promised to take our food order as soon as she finished closing out one of her tables. That's exactly what she did. I have nothing but respect for someone who is obviously super busy, yet still tends to all customers.  I wish I remembered her name because I would give her a shout out here and thank her. The food was good and the service was great!  Thank you

What an awesome place! Yes service is kinda slow but..the patio is nice & they have a lounge kinda bar with a DJ! The food & beer were good & not over priced! Nice place to go on a weekend night for a drink, to dance & play pool! The bar is not packed because not too many people know about it! Too cool!
There are different areas & each area has a different vibe... Try the tiramisu martini... Ah-Mazing!

The food EXCELLENT but the wait ridiculous I waited a 1/2 hour for wings and when I got it wrong order now this is the slow time afternoon PLEASE when you order takeout LOOK at the order because I'm sure this has happened many times not happy with the service get MORE HELP !!!!!!! Oh I paid full price for my wings and waited another 20 minutes so the bartender Hispanic  he was terrible your Oops costed you not getting a tip I don't want free food customer service you need to work on !!! And instead of apologizing he said OOPS this is someone who doesn't OWN up to their mistakes all you had to do was say your SORRY I would've left you a tip and been OK and not write a review on YOUR POOR behavior
uptown is a fun place even if the lanes, and food are OK . live bands are terrible here. I would not go on weekends unless you like terrible cover bands that can hurt your eardrums

Sexist dress code policy treats men and women differently.   We don't tolerate or support such sexism.
Also some weird preference fo sports jerseys
Not going back until they can treat everyone in our group equally.

I have had great service at this establishment. The last time I was there, I was quite melancholy as it was my deceased son's birthday. The bartender and wait staff went the extra mile to make me a drink to remember! I love this place! I live very close by and am absolutely astounded at some of the poor reviews. This is a wonderful place to just go, sit, watch football and have a beer in a comfy seat.
Hands down best place in surprise! Great food, entertainment! WE LOVE IT HERE! We eat dinner here at least once a week. They wedge salad and loaded fries are to die for!

I come here every Tuesday I can, to do the $2-$2!bowling/shoes with my family. I buy food and drinks. The service from the staff in the front could be a lot better. The whole game our bumpers were stuck and we told management, and it was very clear, they did not care. It was not busy and I had to waive down a waitress, twice. I try to shop/ eat local because I am a surprise resident. I hope the staff does see this and works on their willingness to take care of the customers!

Class field trip today.   Customer service has been horrible.   One employee for the entire arcade and laser tag.   Management non existent even after asking for additional help.   Could be sooo much better if the staff actually cared!!

I am giving only 4 stars because the pricing is just outrageous. I have gone to Uptown Alley a few times and it was a great time but everything is over priced! Not only is the bowling extremely expensive but when you go and add another hour they start the clock before you even get back to your lane. So not only are you paying a very inflated price but you get shorted in the process. If the pricing was more reasonable not only would I go more often but I would give a higher review.

I love to take my grandbabies here! They love the mini cheeseburgers and playing all the games! First the young lady who was our waitress was so sweet and just had the best smile with braces, I wish I could remember her name. She was so cute and patient with my grandbabies.tonight there was a young man named Tyler working in the game room who was amazing! He was so patient with my three year old granddaughter, she loves to go into the prize area and take things! He was so good to her and made sure she didn't get upset when we had to make her put things back. I could tell he really enjoys children and it felt very safe for them! He was such a great young man, you can guarantee we will be back and I'm very thankful to this company for having such a great staff!

I was excited to finally see a family place in Surprise besides the movie theatre.  We went with our family of 5 and ended up spending $100 for two games (with shoe rental) and lunch.  I was expecting bowling-alley food and to be fair it was quite tasty, although the calamari I ordered was raw in the middle and I had to send it back.  But the prices are the real problem.  An order of chili fries is a cool 6 bucks, a beer is $5, a plate of sliders is $10.  In and of itself not a big deal, but when you add the steep prices all together for a family it's just not worth it.  I would rather drive to Glendale and get the same fries for $3 with a good pitcher of beer and have a ball bowling without having to watch what I order for the sake of prices.  We were looking for a family-friendly hangout and found a swanky, three-bar sprawling palace.  If your family has unlimited means, this might be the place for you.  For us, it will be a one-time thing.
Great atmosphere so much fun and I love the approach! Lazer tag wasnt pricey and it was a great time for the family!
Had a great time. After 10 was 21 & up. We were in back with a group of 8.   Very fun had dinner food was decent.  Would recommend with friends
Always have a blast here. The staff is wonderful! Highly recommend bringing friends and family.

Red Embers has some great burgers! I added bacon to mine and they definitely gave me a hearty portion. The burger was super juicy too! The food took a while to come out, so try to patient... Deliciousness is on the way ;)

It's a fun place but  can not make a  good lemon drop Martini-why do u say u can and u suck . I make sure I ask before i order and as always the bartender say they can and the Martini here suck so if u want a good drink don't go here

LOVE the 21+ bowling and pool area so my SO and I  didn't have to be around the teenage crowd on our date night.

Did NOT like the restaurant.  Slow service combined with a horrible waitress was just bad.  We ordered a custom burger - and she took the liberty to put on all the other condiments on his burger for him "because everybody else does".  If we wanted the custom burger with all the extras, we would have ordered one and she made us feel stupid for complaining about it.  Not going back to the restaurant side ever again.

I like the back room for pool, and the limited access bowling.... feels like an upscale club...BUT... the bartenders are HORRIBLE. The drinks are poured light and they don't know how to make some basic well drinks with skill... PLUS, the drinks are expensive and the pool is pricey too. I wouldn't mind so much if they had table service for drinks OR they comped some pool for a party of six spending over $150.oo on drinks and snacks. The food is OK, not great tho for the price. Somethings gotta give... train up the b-tenders and get some table service OR comp some pool for the money we spend and the trouble we have to thru to get poor drinks.... come on!

Chef Jill and Company.

My husband and I went to Uptown Alley for his company happy hour. The 21 and over area is pretty awesome! The service was great! My only complaint is the food, mind you that if it was late and someone was highly inebriated the food would hit the spot BUT seeing as it was 7:30pm and I was on my first beer it was not very good. We ordered the cheese fries, pepperoni pizza, pretzels with cheese fondu, and some pizza puff pastry. The pizza was okay and so was the pizza puff pastry... kind of hard to mess pizza up but it has happened lol. The pretzel with cheese fondue was gross, I would NOT call that dip cheese fondue it tasted like something other than cheese and was very liquid like. Almost like someone took a kraft cheese packet and warm milk then mixed them together (yuck), and the cheese fries reminded me of something you would make at home when you are young not realizing that cheddar cheese hardens on your French fries and makes everything stick together plus it gets cold fast. I've seen quite a few restaurants do this and for the sake of all that is holy use nacho cheese (queso) when making any type of nachos or cheese fries because it doesn't harden up! We will be back again to try other things but that's all I have for this visit.

This was a great place to have my son's 9th birthday party. 4 stars for the venue and 3 for the customer service. The kids had a blast, the adults had a good time, and everyone went to bed early this night lol. It's a lovely place to have a party but I would advise you to stay on top of your hostess and make sure they cater to your every need. Ok so now for the bad....

Our server was always almost gone and couldn't be found at times, frustrating because she was getting a large gratuity from my party so I would expect her to be more available to us. When our food came out, they forgot about the birthday boy's special meal (he is allergic to pizza sauce) and he had to wait for his food to come while the other kids sat down and ate. If anything, he should've been served first!!! The pizza tasted like cardboard paper with some cheese and sauce on top of it. For the amount of money we paid for the pizzas and platters, we expect it to at least be tasty!

The girl they had working the bowling desk was rude to me in front of other patrons and she was very fortunate that it was my son's birthday and I didn't feel like getting into it with her while getting 8 pairs of kids shoes. 

My party had a great time in the venue but for a party that was over $500, we expect 5 STAR Customer Service!

For a fun game of bowling, this is the place to go. Modern lane design, good food, entertainment, even a game arcade for the kids. If you want to hang out with friends for food and drink in a more adult environment, there is a second bowling area with its own lanes and bar, lounge chairs, a dance floor area, a DJ to handle the music, and pool tables.

Thumbs up for the young lady (Andrea R) at the arcade register. She's was cool and collective when issues with the registry system was failing. 
Not only was she calm with a smile but was able to multitask other areas while waiting for a fix. 
The now long line of Customers were confident in her because she was calm and moving forward with finding solution. 
I will definitely come back again. 
Was able to bring teens to have some fun to kick start their MDW.

Did not expect the great service and great food. The place was pretty empty and the staff accidentally missed us because we already had drinks. But man did they more than make up for it by offering the kids free game cards and ice cream when the "sorry" was more than enough. Will definitely come back here. The whole staff is awesome.

I just want to say I love this place, we go to uptown alley at least 3-5 times a week. I am not the best bowler in the world but recently we have been going more and more to improve our games. The environment is very clean and the staff is really great. I can't complain one bit. Their pool is about 12 dollars for an hour, their bar is clean and the waitress is cool. The laser tag is a lot of fun it is 2 stories tall and you can have a lot of fun with your friends here. I really enjoy coming here and will continue to be coming here for a while to come.

We took our 13 year old grandson bowling, for lunch, and to the arcade.
Our pizza lunches that included Caesar salads were delicious and the service was excellent!
The bowling was great!
Our only complaint is that the arcade is seriously overpriced!
Highly recommend the food in the restaurant!

Restaurant, bowling alley, a bar, arcade games, private party areas....

They have tons of amenities for the whole family! 

We usually go bowling and play games with the kids at this spot. A blowing alley that lights up to create a dance floor type of feel, added by the upbeat, heart pounding music helps give energy and life to the lanes. 

The food is average at best. Its bowling alley, bar food so expectations can't be set too high.

Service is below par, we usually find ourselves looking for a server more so than actually feeling like she's checking on us.

This is how you do entertainment. Um, let me modify that for clarity, this is how you do entertainment for several target audiences. Young, old, sports fans, bowlers, gamers, and the list goes on. I live much closer to this awesome venue now and as long as they keep doing things right, I should be a regular for some time to come.

The first time I visited Uptown Alley was when a friend of mine's band was playing there. Yes, I said they had a live band. When I heard he was playing at a bowling alley, my suspicions of his talents were in question. This was my first time to see him play, mind you. Low and behold, my buddy drummed like a mad man and sang like a boss! Which brings me to my point, this was much more than just a bowling alley. It is a rather sprawling multi-purpose facility. Restaurant, arcade, laser tag, bar, sports lounge, and of course bowling. It's a pretty massive place. I had a couple beers, listened to the music, and called it a night. Very good first impression.

My most recent trip was with family to go bowling. We walked right up, grabbed some shoes, and I was chucking gutter balls before you could say "SSSTTTTEEEEEERIKE!" (best said in Al Bundy tone). We ordered a plate of bacon cheese fries while we played a lazy game of pins from a very attentive and pleasant waitress. The bacon cheese fries were pretty good. They sat like a bowling ball in my guts but bowling was never cultured as a San Franciscan vegan sport anyway. I also never saw the bottom of my glass which is always good. Fear not, it was only tea. After a couple games of bowling around the corner to the arcade and some games of air hockey we went. Nobody was injured, so I call that a win.

I would like to emphasize the staff here. I have never had an unpleasant interaction with any of them. It's not like I specifically interviewed anyone and asked about their hopes and dreams but I think you know what I mean. They were knowledgeable, efficient, and best of all friendly. You absolutely need that at an establishment like this. It just makes wrangling the kids together easier knowing you are going to a place where the only attitude you will get is when your kid bowls a better game than you. It's also handy when bellying up to the bar and bartender gives you a smile. It just brings a place like this up a notch from an already solid entertainment model.

This place is great. It's clean, has a warm feeling, and is inviting as soon as you go through the front doors. The layout is logical and easy to navigate. Long rounded walkways make it fun just to travel around the different areas of Uptown Alley whether you are going to the bar for a beer or to the restaurant to rejoin your party. Even the walls are infused with decorative glass or at the very least have paintings to keep the flow going. There are private lanes and rooms for the more mature patrons giving the option of getting a little more intimate with your friends and/or significant others. So the next free night you have with some buds or the family, head on down with a couple dollars and an some energy for fun because this place is sure to have something up your alley. 

I sort of feel bad for that last line, but I am going to leave it in anyway.

Such a fun place. We went on a Saturday afternoon and the place was packed. I don't necessarily think that's a bad thing though. We didn't have to wait at all, got right on to our lane and bowled 3 games. It was a little pricey and warm(but what isn't in Arizona) but we had a really great time. I can't wait to venture in to the restaurant and arcade/laser tag. I hear this is a really popular place on Thursday nights.

We went on a wednesday afternoon so it was pleasant.  My wife and I had a good time.  The service was good and curtious.  We asked to not be put by a bunch of kids and they accommodated.  I have read previous reviews and could see this place at night or on a weekend acting chaotic and like a night club, but for a weekend day and to do some bowling with my wife it was perfect.

We went to Uptown Alley to bowl and play laser tag with our family. It is clean and inviting when you enter. All the staff seemed friendly and helpful. We bowled 2 games with our kids first. The bowling area was comfy and inviting. A good thing to know when bowling with children, you can set up the bumpers to just be on for the kids turn and not all bowlers on that lane. We enjoyed the chip trio (3 dips with chips) for $10.99. The dips were good,maybe a tad under salted, but would order them again. The overall the taste and presentation seemed worth the money. The waitress was very attentive and friendly and supplied us with additional chips to finish the dips and was great at making sure we had enough to drink- even though we only asked for water. The laser tag area was big, air conditioned well, and had plenty of hiding areas and the upper level. 
We will definitely be going back to enjoy some more fun. My only negatives are that it can get pricey (but what can't for a family of 4-6?) I was hoping we could find coupons or specials for combo pricing, but no such luck. 
We recently (in July) visited Wazees World for our sons birthday and compared to Uptown Alley, we would definitely go back to UA. We would have heard about UA sooner if they had more advertising!

I was not looking forward to eating here. It was loud as we entered with games on tvs, bowling, an arcade and an open kitchen. But we were pleasantly surprised by the service and really good burgers.  In the end the noise wasn't bad we even stayed to play in the arcade after eating.  It turned out to be a great evening.

What sucks about this place is that it could be SO AWESOME if they got their act together. It seems like EVERY TIME I go there the staff screws something up. My latest example was tonight when I wanted to play laser tag. We called ahead and said all systems were go. Then we show up and they say it is closed for a private party? The bowling is expensive. There is nothing special about it to justify the higher price. What sucks is that they know they don't have to provide good service because they are the only game in town. Oh well...
This place has everything! Best bowling alley ever! Love the fact that they have separate adult bowling lanes as well.

For the time being, this may be the best "total package" entertainment venue on the West-Side of Phoenix (Surprise). It has food/drinks (3+ bars throughout)/arcade/laser-tag/bowling/pool/darts/live music/many TV's & a great VIP area sectioned off for the 21+ crowd.
We had a lot of great service here, but in particular, Ryan G.
Ryan answered all of our questions regarding laser-tag, and the arcade. Later that night ended up cleaning our table (near the pool/darts tables) and was very friendly & customer service oriented. Thanks Ryan!

Our group recently held a bowling tournament at Uptown Alley in the hopes of not just raising funds for scholarships for students in our district, but also to spread some community spirit by supporting a new(er) local business. This review is based on our entire experience.

First of all, Uptown Alley does not really give you any breaks for a group event--not even if you are 501(c)(3) or raising funds for a good cause which they knew was our purpose. They charged us $2 each for shoes and  $15/hr per lane (we had 20 lanes reserved). So essentially, we would have to raise at least $1000 just to break even. We were told they would open up early for us at 8AM but we had to be out by 10AM when they opened. Come to find out they already open at 8AM on Saturdays so they weren't doing us any big favors. They wouldn't help us advertise our event in their facility even though it would have helped draw people to their business. They offered us no freebies to our participants to encourage them to come back. Our group has over 2000 members in the local community that we could market Uptown Alley to and support as a local business but nope...they weren't interested in that at all. We weren't allowed to bring in donuts, juice, coffee or any food related items for our participants even though it was supposedly before they opened for business. We had to order from their restaurant with the sampling of breakfasty type items they had. Essentially, we were made to feel like they were REALLY going out of their way and doing us a favor by even allowing us to have our event there at all. If we weren't so set on trying to support a local business, we really would have gone somewhere else but our group really does make an effort to keep it local whenever possible. 

The day of our event went off without a hitch. The staff was polite, courteous, helpful, kind and considerate. This definitely made up for the way we were treated in arranging this event. The bowling was fun with plenty of space, broad shoe selection, decent food, and drinks. The service was a bit slow considering they knew we had a group coming. There was 1 server for all of us and we were the only people in the place...which did open at 8AM per the sign on the door and their website! And he didn't really come back to check on us so my lane's guests only had 1 drink and that was it. The food was alright though and was definitely not what you would expect from bowling alley cuisine. Our group had fun though...but I think it's because it was a fun activity. I mean who doesn't enjoy BOWLING?

As I've understood it in my efforts to market this event, Uptown Alley isn't very community friendly at all. Our district's special education classes don't even go here because they won't give them a break on price! They go to Peoria to AMF! I'm sorry but if you can't support Special Olympics or SPED and give those kids a break, that's just not saying much about your business's philosophy.

So, although I'd like to say I'd go back to Uptown Alley because they are a local business and its important to support local businesses, it  might be solely as an independent person but not as part of my 501(c)(3) group.  I'm inclined to pass on group efforts since I believe that local businesses should also be supportive of the community. It's got to be a give-and-take relationship.
I love this place, it would have a full 5 stars if the u didn't have to wait 2 hours for a lane and it wasn't so expensive. But maybe there is a wait lost u could call and reserve a spot.

We come here almost EVERY Thursdays night because of their awesome "BAND/karaoke" night and the staff is usually chill and cool.. 

The last time we were here (just me and my bf), we ordered chicken wings, nachos, pizza, mozzarella sticks, southwest rolls, French dip & drinks from the bar. 

Got called up to sing up on stage.
Took our food to a table close to the stage.. and when we came back, no more than 5minutes later, all our food was gone. I confronted the girl that was cleaning up our table and told her that "We weren't done yet..", all of the plates weren't even empty at all and she didn't even turn around to look at me and all she said was "oh well.." And CONTINUED what she was doing!! I WAS HELLA SURPRISED OF HOW RUDE THAT GIRL WAS WHEN I APPROACHED HER NICELY.

I talked to the lady bartender right away, who by the way is just always super sweet and nice to everyone, talked to the manager that night about the incident and the manager came to talk to me but didn't apologize (I'm guessing he was busy running around the whole placer hat  ) , but the lady bartender was apologizing for the girl's mistake, and the manager said he'll take 50% off everything we ordered that was thrown away so we still paid, I guess since we did eat some of the food that was thrown away, when I'm almost 99.9% sure most restaurants would have comped that if this was the situation but he didn't, maybe he's a new manager. But we just wanted to get out of there so we paid without anymore conflicts. 

My bf and I used to worked in the food&beverage industry and we know it's really not just the food that makes the guests come back but the hospitality of the staff and service too.
Ryan was our bartender here one night and was so entertaining and friendly. Very quick although it appeared he was working alone. Great atmosphere!

Great place! Fun bowling, games and Lazer tag. I had my daughters 10th birthday party here and it was a great success! Shannon took unbelievably good care of us. Everyone in our party was impressed by her great service. She was welcoming, friendly and attentive. I went with the bowling upgrade package which included games and Lazer tag. It was a great value. Everyone in our party had a great time and said they would come back. All the facilities are brand new and top notch. There is something for everyone. I would highly recommend this to anyone for any occasion. Thanks for the fun Uptown Alley. We will be back soon.

What a rude management on a Christmas Day! Blowed up my mind ! Ended up to cancel my playlist for principal! Watching just friends game.... my last freaking time here!!!! 
Better to spend my money someplace else !

I come here once a week for a reason, happy hour, half price beer and apps. They have an okay selection if beers and tons of great apps, the nachos are huge and only four bucks. The wings are great and the sliders are killer. Anyone in surprise should come check this place out, bowling is a little expensive and the arcade section is pretty little but I love to come here and drink and share apps with my friends.
Way over priced. The food is horrible, service ok, and games are super expensive.  Wouldn't recommend, stinks it's the only bowling alley close by.
I love coming to this place. My daughter and I always have fun. They have really good lanes. The food is amazing.

My review for the restaurant: took my family here they had specials on food for happy hour. First the service was awesome and I had no complaints. The food is good and very reasonably priced. They have a wide selection and food and tons of tvs to keep you entertained.

The only complaint I have about this place is about the arcade. They charge money to purchase a card so you can spend more money to load it so you can use it for the video games.

It if was not for the awesome service I would have given 4 stars

I attended Circle k employee event held here at Uptown Alley. We had a private room called The Approach with 10 lanes,2 pool tables, and bar.The food was great and service was outstanding. I'll definitely going back .
March madness beer special is nice $2 drafts anytime.  Wish they'd play the audio from the sports games.  Food's always good

My husband and I and another couple have attended Uptown Alley a few times now over the last few weeks.  We have never actually bowled or tried any of the other activities accept for eating and drinking, so I can only speak to that.  
The happy hour is a really good deal.  During happy hour you can get appetizers for half price.  We always order the steak and blue cheese flatbread.  I always ask for it to be medium rare so that the steak will at least come out medium.  I have also had the BBQ pulled pork sliders and the BBQ wings.  I'll order those again!  You can get a well drink for about $2 and change.  Even when the drinks are full price they aren't bad.
They have a 21 and over area which is nice.

I've been here before but to the Phoenix location. Recently I moved and went again to the surprise location and fell in love with the place. I have been two or three times to the surprise location. Uptown alley has bowling, two side bars, pool table, laser tag and arcade games. It is so much fun! Oh and food. I must not forget food. Haha, as well as tv. I believe the laser tag is only $2. The bowling is also pretty cheap. But bring socks, other wise you have to pay for that too. Which if you're a penny pincher like me, you don't wanna have to pay for socks you'll never actually wear besides to go bowling. I'm not sure what the food tastes like. I haven't had it before. Not that I can remember. But I definitely recommend this place. Oh and I think sometimes at the surprise location they have karaoke. I've seen them have karaoke. And they are also open much later than most places which is nice cause then if you live in the area and want to stay out late, it's the perfect spot! :)

We were lucky enough to receive a VIP invitation for today's grand opening! We did a lot in the three hours we were there, when you walk in it makes you feel like you are in one of the Las Vegas Casinos. Even though they claim to be a family theme bowling alley. To me it's more of a young adult theme event. But there is nothing wrong with that. To much to tell you about this place. You must pay a visit or get on there web site for more info. I felt like a kid again, playing in the arcade for a couple of hrs. Food is really good at their restaurant, especially their boom boom shrimp!! Awesome!! Again, a must visit at least once so you can see how it is.

My family and I visited Uptown Alley for the first time yesterday. We bowled 10 frames, had a bite to eat while we bowled (with my 1.5 year old so it took a little longer) and then walked around to check the place out. 

The overall feel of the place is great. There is a restaurant, an arcade, the bowling lanes, VIP bowling lanes and a lounge w/dance floor. I also heard there was a two story laser tag area although we didn't see this. 

The bowling was wonderful--almost all the lanes were filled. We ordered the pepperoni pizza, fried mozerella and a beer. The food was delicious! My only complaint was that the waiter told me that for a pint of Fat Tire the cost would be 4.25...when it was actually 5.50. Clearly the waiters need to brush up on the menu/cost of the items they are selling.

When we were ready to go, we walked aroun the establishment to see what all it was about. I was really impressed with the lounge area and all the 'nooks and cranny's you could go to realx, have a bite to eat and a cocktail. 

I will give the place another try for sure to see how some of the other areas measure up.

Will update accordingly, but we did NOT bowl since their hours are very short compared to all other bowling alley's normal hours on weekends should be 9am-2am and weekdays one hour earlier is fine but 1am is horrible it's bad that we went for our first time and it was already closing but we only went in for a drink 8.50 for a daiquiri and a pint is 5.00 it's just beer....so being there for only 30 minutes we paid 22.10 before tip for 3 drinks..... ridiculous! It should have been around 5 for drinks and 3 for beer thats reasonable but I'm only judging by the drinks since were looking for a new bar in town......so far not a big deal going sat to bowl but may just go to Peoria lanes....guess well see.

I love this new spot in Surprise. It's great for families during the hot summer days! Surprise really needed something fun for kids and families. For the 21 plus crowd - the private VIP area called The Approach has a full bar and 10 lanes of private bowling. I'm thinking about renting this room out for my next birthday party!

The place gets crowded, so call and make a reservation. 

I tried the food, and it's much more than typical bowling alley food. They have pizza, salads, wings, everything! Their cocktail list is also robust. 

Go during happy hour to get discounts on appetizers and drinks. YUM!

2 thumbs up!

When i first walked into uptown alley I was impressed, there was a good vibe and everything was colorful. Other than the fact that it was a Friday evening and it was packed there is plenty of to keep your self occupied. There is a bar and grill, a arcade, a 2 story lazer tag and obviouslly the bowling alley. My son did the laser tag and loved it, it was cheap and fun, wether it was you and 3 friends or 20 people you don't know it's fun. The food at the grill was ok, not the best food ever but it's just a reastraunt in a bowling alley. The arcade games are cool, there are lots of games I haven't seen before and touch screen games, I was impresses. Finally the lanes, they are new aged modern lanes and those ball return things with new. Screens and everything. There is also a area for adults only that has bowling and pool. All in all I give the bowling alley a 4/5 and I will probably be going back.

Went here last Friday with my wife and sister in law to "The Approach" room towards the back for the over 21 age group. It was only $5/hour more for a lane and great. The place is very clean and well maintained, the environment is fun and exciting, and the food and drink was all well prepared. We bowled for two hours, had al3 trays of appetizers brought out, and all three of us had a few drinks with refills which costs just under $200 for the whole night including tips. Not cheap, but the food and drink prices are pretty competitive with nearby sit down restaurants. Staff was also friendly and helpful, and even asked if we wanted a one hour bowling then add half hours on after. Our last was about to finish short due to the timer, so our waitress added a few minutes for us to take our time paying the bill and finishing the last 2 frames.

We had fun, service was good, but with it being so crowded it was hard to find a table near the bowling and hard to really enjoy the arcade area because of the crowd...but that's a bit to be expected when you have a variety of activities under one building and it being the only of its kind out this way.

The manager of this place is an absolute idiot! We were in with 6 friends, all of whom are in the bar business, spending money in the bar. He comes up to me an demands that I either turn my shirt inside out or leave because it's a Support Trump shirt. Lol, when my girl and I walk out parked out front are 5 squad cars who responded to the dumbass' 911 call. BTW, the officers all liked my shirt!

Just had lunch for the 2nd time and it was bad for the 2nd time. My husband was served the wrong meal and my Cali chicken was the consistency of a thick rubber yoga mat. Upon telling the waitress she just took it away and didn't apologize, ask if she could get me anything else, offer to replace it... Nothing. Will never go back for food there again.

Went in on a Monday to relax and have a couple brews with friends. We weren't immediately available to order when Kristin came to take our order, besides beers. She eventually took our second round order with food. Her service was extremely slow and not personal. I have been in the service industry in a previous life and know you have to work to turn customers into regulars. This was clearly not an intention of hers. She did check back on us once to see if we needed anything but were okay at the time. We kept talking, hoping she'd come by to see if we were tasty to close out/wanted more or anything but nothing. After 45 minutes, with serious consideration for walking out, I had to go to the bar and ask her for the check. She was pretty nice at that point but it was beyond too late. Avoid the place on a Monday night for drinks!!!

This place needs some work for sure! First off how do you not have the ball ramps for younger kids?? You mean to tell me they are all broken?? How frustrating! There were many parents that felt ripped off because of the simple fact that the children were displeased with not being able to bowl with the ramps. It's was a sore sight to see looming down the lanes that every young child was upset cause they couldn't bowl like they anticipated with the ramps. After having bare witness with my grand daughter being let down and disappointed I doubt I will ever return to this place. Can't go wrong with their competitors. One day not have the ramps for kids cost this place my future business.

The actual arcade and bowling alley are extremely clean and functional (no out of order signs on the arcade games). However..... The staff there is less than exceptional. I requested wait service at the bowling alley three times and didn't get it. By the end of the first game I just went to the bar to order drinks and the women behind the bar told me the bartender wasn't here right now but she would be back shortly. 5 or so minutes later she asked me if she could just take my drink order. That being said, The arcade staff was present, attentive and pleasant to interact with.

My holiday work party took place here, but I've been here several times before for happy hour. The happy hour food typically seems pretty good, but I'm not sure if that's the happy hour drinks "talking" or my actual true fondness of comfort appetizers post-work days. 

I like Uptown Alley, because it is one of the few places that you can go to on the West side of town that offers so many things at one place. Maybe I don't want to drive an entire hour to Lucky Strike downtown but I still enjoy the luxuriousness of sitting on nice couches and a "fancier" setting while bowling. Uptown Alley is the answer!

Kids have plenty of fun too! There's a big laser tag area as well as a gaming area that although not quite as big as Dave and Buster's, it still has plenty of similar new games at hand. They're not just for kids either. Adults can partake in the fun too!

There is a restaurant that serves decent food, and they're very well organized at handling private parties. 

If you don't want to be around kids, there's even a separate "club" area for adults only to enjoy bowling, games, and drinks. 

I'm really happy to have this place around! It's so convenient, because you can always find stuff for people with all interests to do or enjoy!

Great place for karaoke!  Very fun atmosphere.

A little over priced for laser tag and bowling.

We recently used uptown alley as our venue for a business meeting/incentive training for our company a few weeks ago. Terry, the general manager gave us a great deal on a package of bowling and food for the evening. My team and I were all pleased with the service, food, and atmosphere of this place. Laser tag also happened to be amazing. Thanks again!

Last week I attended a private event and had an incredibly fun time.  The folks that hosted the event as well as the staff were not only enjoying being with us but were extremely attentive and helpful.  This place feels like a "neighborhood" hang-out.  I have been to this establishment a handful of times and have never been disappointed.  I've eaten dinner and the food and service are top notch.  I've watched sporting events on the BIG screen, played laser tag with my Grandkids and have even bowled a couple of times.  Uptown Alley is by far the best all around entertainment venue in the West Valley (Surprise). It offers everything and at a reasonable price.  They run terrific specials all of the time.  Make sure to book your next Birthday Party or Company Event here....You will not be disappointed !!!

Just got some new beers on tap. Food is good but not great. They had a better menu in the past but they changed it about 2 years ago. Very clean and comfy. It has a 21 and over area. A small area like a club. Live band Friday and Saturday.

After reading all the reviews below im shocked to hear they didn't get good service. Maybe it was our lucky day. Never been here before but we got a good recommendation to try it out. On our way we go. Upon walking in im immediately impressed. Clean,AC running, and smiling faces in the restaurant area. I asked a few questions and we sat down. I immediately wanted to see more so I gave our waitress our drink order and off I went. Good size game area for the kids up front, a couple pool table (wish they had more), Bowling lanes (in black light), 21 & up bowling/Bar area!!!! ( reminds me of SD-EV Tavern+Bowl back home), and some private rooms you can book. Bars looked awesome. Sat back down, Ice cold beer waiting, ordered the pizza/wing special, tacos for my main squeeze, and sliders for the kiddos. Everything came out warm, great timing, and it was delish! the wings especially. Spicy Garlic something wings.....Bomb....cant wait to come back. I can see that they maaaaybe might be slammed from time to time and service suffers....but thats no excuse for not coming here.Maybe its just me but if im not getting service somewhere, I get up and do it myself...especially if you see their busy! 

Oh ya and I totally forgot...I believe the managers name was Tim, but he came by to check on us and gave my little girl $5 game card...SCORE!! 

We'll BE BACK~!

Went to Uptown Bowling to celebrate a friends special event. Food was good, waitress was good. But once it hit like 8pm (maybe 9pm) the Adults only area turned into a "strip joint". The lights went down and video screens went up and apparently instead of Vevo or MTV videos that are appropriate for all races, they only played naked "silhouetted" African Americans. I'm sorry but I didn't pay for 2 hours of bowling to watch naked girls on the screen while I'm bowling. I'm so offended that I will never go back. I get playing to one race, but what about the rest?  I'm not racist or sexist, but seriously...it was totally geared toward the black man.  Unfortunately, that's not the only people in your crowd. I talked to several strangers in the restroom who were as offended as I.
Uptown Funk You Up!!!!   Live entertainment was excellent!  Needed a little more liquid encouragement to dance, but it was on like Donkey Kong!!    Cant wait to do it again!!

They should have a way of making it known that after 10 pm it becomes a 21+ over venue. Most of us had IDs but some didn't , we weren't even planning on drinking , we drove so far as well. I don't understand the logic behind that. Also the staff was rude , I'm guessing they weren't happy we were there 45mins before closing. Only good thing I noticed about this place was that it was clean.  Also I wanna add the atmosphere was not that great as well. Mostly irritated about the 21+ thing.

This place seemed like the perfect place to have a good time and get some food. The facilities here are not to bad (bowling, laser tag, games) bit the restaurant is terrible. Where do I start...

Our waiter I am pretty sure was under the influence of some form of stimulant (meth is my prediction). He was acting all kinds of crazy and saying weird things. It took thirty minutes to get a glass of water, fifteen minutes to get our alcoholic beverages. The mixed drinks were not good at all and all the draft beers tasted the same. I seriously could not tell the difference between Coors Light and Miller Light, so I dont know what they were pushing through those taps. 

Now the food...The food was very bland and plain. Very overpriced. Our meals took forever to get to us and they only brought half or meals. We had to ask for the rest. 

We also had to ask for the check, and then it took forever as our waiter was chatting it up with his friends standing outside the restaurant. Seriously? He also offered the police officer working there a beer that he was holding and then started laughing at his own joke. The cop didn't find it funny, neither did I as I could not wait to get out of there. I will not be back.

Great place for families with kids and a private 21+ area! So if you dont want to be around kids or teens you can go to the back area. Perfect hang out spot and family fun day. Kids bowl free on Mondays.

Food is good, service was great, this is by far the best bowling alley I have been to. We will be here often.

Great place to hangout, especially with large groups. Laser tag, arcade, bowling, 3 full bars, VIP section, lounge, sports area with huge screens, and a pretty good restaurant. We seriously needed something like this in Surprise. I only with they were open later during the week.
Very cool place and very big the 2 hour wait for a lane was excessive but they want you to buy drinks and it worked. Good times

I came back to uptown ally for the second time this week to play some pool and arcade games with friends. I gotta say it was another great experience, I haven't tried the arcade yet and I think it was a bit expensive... a lot of the games took up a lot of your credits in such little time. I left my friend with the card for a few minutes and when I came back half the credits were gone by him only playing the claw machine, that was a bit disappointing. But anyway the pool was great and we had a blast scoring some trick shots and such and we still enjoyed the arcade. I will be coming back here regularly with friends if we ever want to play bowling, pool, laser tag, etc - so 4/5 today.

Worst service ever!!  Second time we have been here. I can honestly say this is the worst service I've ever had. Took my family of 6 adults for two hours of fun. It was $99.00 for all of to bowl. Guy at the counter was rude. Said it's an 1hr half. Ok so let's get some food. We waited 15 mins just for the hostess to seat us. By the time the waiter got to the table the light up thing went off for our turn to bowl.  Had to flag down the waiter to order $100.00 of food and drinks.
1hr later received the pizza then 30 mins later got our drinks (1hr after we ordered) the drinks were all watered down and pizza was soggy. 
Then he never came back. As I was walking out the door he was yelling my name to pay. I wasn't about to go hunt you down! You knew where I was the whole time. Horrible, rude and just unorganized. 
We will never attend this place again.
I hope they build an ally and a theater out here in Surprise that makes uptown ally go out of business. What a waste of $250 bucks.

This place never fails us.  Out of all the places in Surprise, we know we can come to Uptown Alley and be seated within the first 5 minutes.  Food is great, no matter what you pick of the menu. They have a nice twist on their spinach/artichoke dip. I would highly recommend it if you like a little twist to what you would normally expect. Also, their southwester rolls in the appetizer section with the siracha aoili dip were tasty  (if you like some zing). The bartender does great job on drink creations, so whether you go with a drink from the menu or ask them to create something for you, you won't be disappointed.  And service is always superb.
I reserved a party for my boys and the service was great! The server overwhelmed but had a great attitude. I would recommend it!
The drinks are tasty and the band was fabulous!  Enjoyed some dancing and visiting with my friends!

Used to be my family's and Is favorite place to go to spend money. Now they set up false advertised merchandise so you spend all your money only to find out that they don't have what you want or give you every excuse as to why they don't have it while being smug, the only reason I gave more than one star is location to home is good and most of the time there service is good but the service the last 3 years have been flushed, constantly short staffed and the employees barely check on you generally you have to seek someone out to get service. The menu changes every 4-6 months hard to keep track.  Even as a regular I would now choose a different place if it wasn't my daughters 6 birthday and she wanted a redemption gift that wasn't available now not only your business didn't hold up there end of the bargain I as a father feel I didn't hold up mine thanks uptown alley for ruining my day yet again and your management team seems to enjoy the negativity hope you feel good about yourselves. Final note is I asked for the manager on duty and did not get the actual manager only a pawn then noticed the actual manager and had same smug remarks that it's just a display in the redemption area. Seems to be a hit or miss with service anymore half the time it's great and the other half falls way short. Again I have to say after trying to continue to repeat business there service sucks can not redeem your credits for anything al usual have to order so you spend money on game o revive an item you think you can win only to have them say will order it well I ordered something last go and it took freakin 7 weeks I don't spend my  to  wait on something that is displayed unbelievable they made it right jack did an outstanding job shout out for the first time after no one would help he stepped up thanks jack!

My family and I go here ALL THE TIME! We love their food! We also love going there on nights out with friends and seeing our favorite bartender Caludia! She has been our bartender for a year and a half now! She always has a smile on and is very friendly and polite to all her customers! THANKS FOR MAKING OUR TIME AT UPTOWN THE BEST! :)

As mentioned by another reviewer, this place is a great "all in one" spot for everyone from families to friends to single people wanting some nightlife.  

We have been here several times.  They have laser tag and an arcade for the kids.  They have family bowling and private bar area bowling, pool tables, and a full bar/restaurant.  They even had a corn hole tournament going while we were there.  

We showed up and we were told that there was a waiting list for bowling and the wait was about an hour.  This surprised me because there were a lot of empty lanes.  We went to the restaurant to get a bite to eat and were called for bowling about 15 minutes later which was a nice surprise.  Luckily I was able to catch the waiter and tell him we were leaving to bowl before he put our food order in.  I don't think it would have been a big deal though because I think all the food comes from this place anyway and they probably could have delivered it to our lane.  

We got our shoes and lanes and started bowling.  They have music and TVs you can see while bowling.  We ordered food, which was from the same menu and selection as in the restaurant.
