It would have been nice if the waiter at the restaurant told us we could have just kept our order in and they would deliver it to our lane since we were starving and had to wait twice as long, but no biggie.  

The food was great!  A friend had a burger which was awesome.  The fires it came with were also great.  They had great seasoning.  I had pizza which was great also.  The pepperoni were large and flavorful.  

This place isn't cheap but not as expensive as you would think to have someone wait on you at your lane while you're bowling.  This is a far cry from the typical bar food style bowling alley filled with smoke.

My only complaint is if you are a serious bowler it's a little messy.  Because they allow and even encourage people eating at the lane there was a lot of crumbs and food on the floor.  The approach was hideous obviously not clean so there was no glide whatsoever.  I didn't mind, because like I said you would have to be a serious bowler, but I could see how this would annoy those wanting to have a serious game.

I love this place! Arcade, bowling, bars, food, laser tag... I could go on, but I don't want to. The prices are a bit much, but it is like a one stop shop for entertainment. It's nice to have this place. Especially, way out here in Surprise. Fun for the whole family. Service is definitely lacking, but the good times make up for that.

I love this place.  We had a small unofficial birthday party for my youngest step-son here this last weekend.  I didn't do a party package (I priced that it is was pretty steep, but seemed almost worth it cuz of the attention you get and space... ) but anyway.  We still had plenty of room, and lucked out big time to be there during the anniversary party and got 2 for 1 deals on game tag, and great arcade deals.  The kids were so busy we didn't have time to enjoy the anniversary bonus activities, bounce house and face painting.  We also ordered pizza and I was impressed with how yummy it was.  It costs more than it should, but it is good.  Our waitress was super nice also.  The staff we encountered we all in a good mood, even though they were busy, so I really appreciated that.  (We have been here in the past and not experienced this, one employee was more than rude, but I didn't see him this time.)  Cant wait to come back for an adult night with the hubby and get a cab home! :)
2 games for 4 people with shoes was $52.00.   Not horrible.  Not cheap.  Good time?  Yes!

Alley is really nice but the customer service isn't very good. The waitress told my husband once he ordered our drinks that we need to make sure we don't steal the copper mug because she would need to pay $40 out of her own paycheck for it.  The food was cold and the cheese for the pretzels had already separated.  My family and I played in the arcade and they had one person documenting everything bought at a snail speed as the line continued to get longer. I do not recommend nor will we ever go back as the prices are excessive as well.

We have been there a few times. We love that there is so much to do in one spot. A great place to meet friends and hang out. The only issue I have is that it closes so early on the weekends. We would've loved to have a full adult night out. 

We have yet to experience everything this place has to offer but we had fun in the adult section and plan to use it for our birthday next year!

My family and I love bowling and Uptown Alley is a great place. What I love is the food and drink. It isn't like any other bowling alley where they only have burgers, fries and nachos. They have a real restaurant in there.

Now, there is a piece of advice that I would really like to give to Uptown Alley's management team. The advice I want to give them is to please somehow instruct all of their customers about bowling etiquette either by explaining to them what bowling etiquette is or by posting it so that everyone can see exactly what bowling etiquette is supposed to be.

Every time I bowl here it seems like there's a family next to me or a couple or what have you that when I'm standing up ready to bowl they're not giving me my space. They are also trying to bowl themselves while I'm still trying to bowl next to them and you're supposed to wait for the person next to you to finish bowling before you step onto the wood and pick up your ball.

I don't think it would be that difficult to hand out a flyer that explains the rules or to Simply verbalize the rules when they pick up their shoes and pay for their bowling so that everyone is on the same page because nothing frustrates me more than somebody that is disrespectful to others and people need to know that when it comes to bowling. If you're there to bowl have respect and don't have your kids running around and all kinds of other nonsense.

I was considering giving this a four-star instead of a five-star but the fact that people don't have respect is not the bowling alleys problem or responsibility so I gave it a five-star but food for thought, maybe you guys can do something to alleviate the problem.
Awesome place. Shannon the bar tender is legit! Good food. Bipolar music. We had nachos prime dip and burgers. All were very yummy. Great place to go on a Saturday afternoon.

Been here numerous times for various different occasions. This bowling alley is a lot newer and a lot nicer than a lot of other ones. Highly recommended for a date night spot, with good food, arcade games, and even laser tag. There's something for everybody here.
Great place to go bowling! Great atmosphere and the food is really good. Especially the wings!! Definitely recommend it!

We had my daughter's birthday party here and everyone had a great time!  Izzy was our server and she was excellent!  Give that girl a raise!  I scheduled for 2 hours of bowling, that included 2 lanes, unlimited sodas, 2 pizzas, and a GIANT cookie.  Izzy helped all the kids get their shoes and balls, she got all of our drinks and food, even helped serve it.  The atmosphere is awesome, definitely the best bowling alley I've been to!  I'll definitely be back, especially for an adult night!  I hear they have a live dj and live band, karaoke, laser tag, pool tables, arcade, and did I mention a full bar!?

There's a lot to do here at Uptown Alley. I've been here for laser tagging with kids as well as happy hour with adults. There is a wide range of activities to do while you're there no matter what age. My personal favorite is the laser tag, although I do wish the arena was a little bigger as there are not many spots to hide when you're playing. 

The red ember restaurant is pretty good, but is a pretty typical American-style restaurant.

I bring my son here all the time to hang out with his friends to bowl and play laser tag. I got an email from Uptown inviting us to test out new menu items. The food was AMAZING! Loved everything! My son had the watermelon salad- yum and the chicken alfredo pizza- also yum. His friend had the mozzarella sticks- made with fresh cheese and to die for! I had the avocado egg rolls and the chicken wrap- perfect amount of spice and REALLY REALLY good. I would have never have thought to come and eat here before because I thought it was more of a kids place! The bar and restaurant are VERY nice and our waitress was spectacular! I will definitely be back! I might even play laser tag!

Stopped here on Sunday Afternoon to watch some football as we had seen their really nice outdoor patio, and we like outdoor patios.  Lots of visible screens from outside, good drinks, good food, great staff and a great patio.  We have not taken advantage of all the stuff in the huge indoor area, but will be next time there.

Really cool environment, I like the 21+ area because it's a little more calm and quiet than the other side, the drinks are always amazing and so is the food, i mainly got appetizers to snack here and there in between drinks with friends and will be back definitely.
Pretty cool place. Somewhat pricey for families.

Its a cool place to go, especially due to its location. Not much else going on in surprise, so this place will thrive. 

The place is spacious, with lots of bars, and places to sit. The arcade section is kind of small...btu hey, there's an arcade section! You can also play laser tag...pretty cool. They have a lounge section which is nice, but when we sat down at the couch section, no one came to take our order. It was the same in the adult lounge/bowling alley. Plenty of places to sit, plenty of employees walking around yet no one to take a drink order. To bowl in the adult section is pricey...i think it was approx 30 bucks. 

All in all, a nice place to go if you live in suprise.

Brought my 11 year old and his friend for laser tag and games and thought my husband and I would bowl while we waited for the kids.  We were told it was a 2 1/2 hr wait so needless to say we didn't get to bowl even though there was actually a lane not being used.  The kids had fun but the one thing they were disappointed in was that their game cards didn't have any points to spend on toys etc... $50 in games yet no points issued?  You can't give kids cheesy toys or crappy candy to make them feel like it was worth spending time here?   No thanks!   We'll find something else to do next time! 

We did order food for the kids and that was good!   This place has decent food with decent prices. .  They just don't care about their customers experience b/c it's the only place out here so no competition to worry about!

Been here several times and always have a good experience.  My kids enjoy the bowling and games.  The food and drinks are reasonable.  Food is above average bar food.  The pretzel bite things are the best.  Prices are average.  Sometimes the wait staff leaves you hanging...that's my only complaint.

We did not eat here but we did play games and they were so super! Incredibly clean and well maintained which was great! They had way better prizes as well and I loved the fact that we did not have to hold tickets they loaded directly to the card. I totally want to go back and eat and bowl though!
Too loud, too out of control, no staff around to offer any help. Screaming preteens running wild everywhere right next to adults drinking. Bad combination if this is supposed to be a family hangout.
Very cool place!  When bowling, service is slow. Just go get drinks or food from the bar! Otherwise, great atmosphere and nice set up in the bowling alley!

The restaurant inside deserves 10 stars!! Inside out taquito and Philly cheese steak with actual cheese wiz!! We have all of our company Christmas parties at the bowling alley and they treat us great, always on top of everything and it's a blast!!

I'm giving this place 5 stars because the concept is awesome.  I have only been here twice but I am certain I will go back.  It is a huge place with a bar (2 I think), arcade, upscale bowling alley, laser tag, and I am sure i am missing stuff because I have not even walked the entire place.  It is nice, new, and upscale for a casual place for families.  It is really loud which is good if you already have kids since you don't want yours standing out.  There are huge TV screens all over and one that must be over 100", the drinks are decent and the prices are typical (don't come here if you are cheap).  The service is pretty good, never had a problem and the food was okay but all I have eaten was steak sliders (which barely had sliced beef on it) and chicken fingers (cant really screw that up).  I do want to go back and eat here again since I really didn't go hungry so to be fair I wont deduct for the food.  I really appreciate places like this for families to go.  So once again it gets 5 stars just for existing and if you demand perfect service or complain about every little thing,  I really don't want you to be in the same building as me anyway...you are probably annoying.
A+ on customer service! Especially from Kristin J - director of sales and marketing. She went out of her way to make a great experience affordable to our school.
Took my nine-year-old daughter and her friends for her birthday. She had a great time!! The staff was great. The arcade is fun. And for the adults the bar has a good selection

Been here plenty of times and always encounter SOMEONE on staff with an attitude! servers at the Red Embers restaurant are slow forgetful and act like me asking for good service is such a hassle! Thank God for Claudia, the bartender at the bar in that area! She always goes around to the tables the patio wherever, to make sure everyone has their drinks food or has even been helped. Went with a group of co workers ordered drinks waited around 5...10....15 minutes and Claudia came over, she must've seen us looking around thirsty, and asked what we ordered... No writing anything down just went straight to the bar got our drinks and came back with them BEFORE the server ever came back to ask what we had ordered again! As far as the place it is a great environment, so many things to do and great place to meet up for drinks, dinner, arcade, bowling whatever. Just wish there were more people like Claudia on staff!!

I hate that this place isn't better! It's a nice place and mostly clean but the staff here is horrible in every department! Took my kids here on 3/22/17 and we were just going to bowl a couple games. We waited in line and the girl at the counter was miserable looking and just asked "how many?" I said "hi I have 3, and we need a ramp, are there any available?" She rolled her eyes and said no, all our lanes are full. It will be a long wait. And then she turned around and walked away.... ummm...ok??? 
I decided to go to the arcade to kill some time while we waited. The guy at the arcade counter never smiled or said hello either (apparently you don't have to be a people person to work here). I asked what was the best deal on card prices and he just pointed to a sign...after about an hour of games we cashed in our tickets and went to go check if the lanes cleared. 
The same not so friendly girl was there and took down my name and number so she could call me once a lane was cleaned. After about 20 minutes we were called and paid. I asked the girl if someone would be bringing us a ramp, or where to get one and she just said "they are over in that area where your lane is".... ok??? I've never been here before so I don't know where that is... we get our shoes and the guy who helped us was nice. He helped carry my sons' lightweight balls to our lane(he had to look up our lane because the girl never told us, she just said "over there". The shoe guy also got us a ramp, super helpful. 

So, there was only one server and she was busting her butt trying to get to everyone. Management really should've had another girl on the floor. We didn't even get drinks until we were there for an hour. And no management was even on the floor checking on people who were upset. Horrible. Also, into our 1st game a ball got stuck in the gutter behind the bumper, I called and spoke to the not-so-friendly girl up front and she said she'd send someone to get the ball... nobody did. By the end of the second game, the server actually saw it and got it herself. Honestly, I'm probably never going back because of the service, or lack there of. Sucks to suck and this place is the worst!
This place is a joke... workers work their hardest and management sucks... get new management and maybe I'll think about going back.. I'll be spreading the word around ...

Came here for a family get together/nephews bday party. Overall, staff wasn't friendly. Had no customer service skills. We waited for an hr to get on our lanes, so in the meantime, we wanted to order drinks and appetizers for the kids. It took forever for us to find anyone willing to acknowledge us. We walked over to one of the bars. The bartender looked right at us and walked out. They had closed this bar because they said it was too slow, however we were there on a Saturday evening and the place was apparently pretty busy considering we had a hr wait! Finally got on our lanes and on the 3rd frame, one of our lanes malfunctioned. Again, it took a miracle to locate a manager, so we told our server the issue. She told us she would tell her manager. Again, we wait. And wait. The family members who were on the other 2 lanes continued playing; they got thru their first game while the other family members sat & waited for a new lane or someone to repair the guard that sweeps the floor after the pins fall. The manager was kind, but really offered no solution since all the lanes were busy. (Other bar was still closed even though every lane was being used...and yes, people had cocktails, so opening the other bar would've made sense). All in all, we shoulda just went to a Brunswick bowling alley. Won't be back. We spent a lot of money there too. What a shame. The manager ended up comping the one lane and gave the kids $15 game cards so the rest of our group could bowl, but we had to make that request ourselves.

This is your standard Bowling and Entertainment Center. The food is good, service is good, and the place is clean. You can eat, drink, bowl, play games, lazer tag, ect..
Only complaint is that the dinning areas are a little too loud for dinner conversation.

Huge place. Great selections of games while you wait for your lane. You can call ahead to reserve your lane. The have a private area with a bunch of lanes for 21 and up. Good music. The food is great. Friendly staff. Just slightly unorganized.

We visited Uptown Alley last night for our first time. The atmosphere was pretty neat and upbeat. We decided to eat dinner before hand, which was all around good service and good food. We decided to purchase a hour of bowling. Our bowling lane kept malfunctioning during the hour. We ended up speaking with a manager after our server had to reset our lane about six times. Ryan really took care of us and made our experience a really good time. He is a great example of awesome customer service. Thank you! We will be back.

Don't waste your time or money. I used to come here almost every other weekend and had horrible service and was always waiting a long time to be helped! Until we had a server, Ashley D, who was always on top of it and my family and I always requested her as our server, but just recently learned she no longer works there and I will not be returning! Management is unhelpful and everyone else is slow!

I use to come here all the time back in the day! I have some great memories here. But to get to the point the workers are awesome. Anything you need they will go out of their way to accommodate you and make you happy. The bowling is fun lol especially when you have the bumpers up  (all strikes I swear). The food isn't bad and the drinks are perfect. You'll find a lot of people in the military here because it's so close to the base. Overall this place is pretty awesome. Hopefully I can come back when in AZ. 


Give it a try

My kids had a blast here! My husband and I really enjoy bowling, so the atmosphere was a great plus. The arcade had my kids reeling. We didn't try laser tag, but we are considering this place for my son's 6th birthday party.

My family really enjoys this place. I'm giving a four rather than five star only because I feel the price to bowl is excessive compared to other bowling alleys. You can catch a break if you come very early on a Saturday. I've had two birthday parties here for my son. It's a good place to do a party. The hosts are always kind and accommodating. The food is decent. Our favorite is the Old Bay wings. It's always crowded here so it's clear the city's residents love it here.

My family and I have been having a great time watching the NBA playoffs and Finals. Watched game 4 there the other night and the place was extremely busy. Our server was Amira and she busted her tail off all night. My son and I witnessed x3 different groups who got served the whole game and either didn't tip or "dine & dash". Just wanted to say good job to Amira for her work ethic and her manager Rocky for handling some drama.
Great family fun but a little expensive unless you have one of their coupons. The facility is nice and clean. The only bowling alley in Surprise.

I don't expect a perfect experience everywhere all the time, because things happen but.... The last few times we've come here, there seems to be something off. Whether it's the service or the quality of the food. Today takes the cake though! Five people in our party and we ordered a small cheese pizza, two bacon burgers one plain cheese burger and one "stuffed" burger. All four burgers arrived approximately 20 minutes later without the pizza. I grabbed my burger and cut it to see how they stuffed it. It's not stuffed with green chiles, bacon and cream cheese as it's assumed (the way the menu reads) but It was layered on top. We asked about the pizza and you could tell the food expediter had no idea what we were talking about. After she left to check on the pizza I took a bite and noticed mine was cold, all of them were but the other three were starving so ate it any way. Mine was truly cooked perfectly but none the less, cold. The server arrived to tell us she had no idea what happened with the pizza, she was very nice and immediately apologized taking my food back to the kitchen. Approximately 15 minutes later she arrived with what I assumed was a new burger I noticed the bun had been cut and I thought it was weird that this one was but not the previous. I grabbed the bun and you could tell they microwaved it because it was so hot, it was hard to hold on to. Still not stuffed, and this one was over cooked but I did eat one side. As I grabbed the second side I couldn't help but bust out laughing because they actually reused the meat I already had taken a bite out of, they just gave me a new bun. I immediately asked for the manager and a gentleman named Jack came over. Jack was very professional and just as flabbergasted as I was. He apologized profusely and said he really didn't know what else to say. I exclaimed, it's so ridiculous you can't help but laugh. Jack took all four burgers off our bill and kept saying he doesn't know what he could say to make it better. So I say to you, Mr. Red Embers Kitchen Manager, the only reason we'll return is because of the customer service given to us  by Jack after that food debacle.

As far as Surprise is concerned this is your best bet for a fun day out with the Fam close by. Decent food, full bar, bowling, arcade games and laser tag so you have something for everybody. 

The service is hit or miss so don't expect much there. Kids can cash in tickets for prizes and there's a decent amount of games to play. The seperate set of bowling lanes inside the bar area are nice for a more upscale vibe and environment. 

If I didn't live in or near surprise I wouldnt drive out to visit this location. However, since I do I live near by im definitely glad it's out here.

The whole setting of this bowling alley is awesome, but the employees are rude and don't have manners. We were there on a Sunday night and we went up to the bar to order a drink. My husband asked for a pitcher of beer and the bartender with spiky hair said with a rude tone of voice that they didn't have pitchers there. He made us feel very uncomfortable. After we got our beers we went to go bowl. We asked for service so we could order something to eat and we waited around 20 minutes and nobody came to help us, so we decided to leave. As we were leaving my husband saw that there was a laser tag so we were going to go check it out and automatically the girl that was working there by all the prices yelled at us and said we couldn't go in there since there was a game going on. This was our first time here so we didn't know how things worked. We had heard good things about this place, but our experience was horrible! We definitely won't be coming back again.

I have to say, the game room is pretty fun, could be more spacious with more games, like DDR or something. The food at Ember Grill was horrifying. Spent way too much money for a bad pizza. I have no yet tried bowling. The only  reason why I am giving this 3/5 is that it is pretty fun to take kids to the game area. That's about it.

Poor service. Poor service.. Poor service. Food is so so..
Need to conduct some serious training here.

Okay. Being in town yet again for Spring Training. For a third year in a row. Uptown Alley is a destination in Surprise after a Padres vs Ranger game. The first two times were fun memorable times. This time, memorable but not too fun. Let me retell my tale.
We get to the place to find out that there was a two hour wait to bowl. Which isn't in itself the worst thing in the world. We can go into the restaurant/bar and have drinks and eat a good meal. Problem solved. Hmmm...no, not really. More like a problem starting to develop.
With no hostess in sight. Not sure if she was on break, taking care of an customer issue or whatever else. We sat our nine person party ourselves; our party consisting of seven adults and two minors. Then the waiting game continued. Which was part our fault I have to admit.
Flagging down a few employees. The employees said that they would get someone to serve us. This however became somewhat of a joke after a few more moments. Finally we get the restaurant/bar manager to serve us herself.
Let me first to say. I also run a business that serves customers; so I know how trying it is to serve a lot of people at the same time. So our group and I cut her some slack.
I wish the problems stopped there though. They didn't. I ordered a coke and water but didn't get a coke until my food came. I resorted to drinking my wife's soda in the meantime.
My food didn't come for at least thirty minutes. Ten mango habanero hot wings, six small celery sticks plus a side of blue cheese. Thirty long minutes. But that isn't the kicker. My wings weren't deep fried in a fryer. I believe they were microwaved; and they came to the table COLD. Hot wings aren't hot wings if they are cold. Let me repeat. I waited thirty minutes for cold hot wings. Oxymoron!!!
Sending them back. I got another ten wings ten minutes later. I am guessing the same wings I sent back plus one new one. This time they were warm. Not cold but not hot...warm (sigh). Being real hungry at this point. I tried my best to eat them. I couldn't get past five. They were bad. As of this review. I have been up since 4 am with the worst heartburn. Thanks to five mango habanero  WARM wings. After eating, we decided to just leave. No bowling. No video games. No anything else. We were done as a group.
Let me end with this. The lady manager was a nice lady doing her best. The only reason I am giving any stars. I also didn't have to pay for the wings. She took it off the final bill. 
This however needs to be a wake up call for management to really look at their operation to succeed in the future. It will take a lot for me to ever come back here. It was a disappointing experience for sure. If you continue down this path. If you piss too many people off. You won't have a business to run at all.

Their management sucks ! And the employees are not well informed ! I called to see how old the guardians of younger children had to be and they said 21 I get there all the way from 30th Ave and  when I get there they don't let my family and I in on my birthday ! They need to train their employees better!!
Great evening out with adults or parties. We love going with our kids the food is great!

Day shift manager on 5/6/2017 said they would not honor the yelp 20% off coupon. It's a nice, well kept, facility but food delivieries are slow and they are much more expensive than  other alleys in the west valley. If you're going with a big group definitely check elsewhere because it may be worth the travel.

Hi. Was visiting from out of town. First of all the "waitress" forgot about Us for almost one complete game. They did finally remember us. Then, the "waitress" accidentally charged our card 300 dollars instead of 30 dollars. They said they corrected it, but it will take a days to have it back on the account. The manager at my request came and spoke with us, but didn't offer any compensation, just that if there any issues they would take care of it. We were having a great time and it was our last night in town. It's kinda put a damper on the evening. Very disappointed and do not recommend this establishment.

Best bowling in the Valley

Went bowling with my wife and little girls on a Sunday.  Uptown was very busy and we had a 1.5 hour wait.  But, it timed well for us to hit dinner before a couple games and worked out.

Staff is very nice, but seems to struggle with the rush of people constantly hitting them. Some management structure and training would go a long way toward helping them provide a better overall customer experience-- have multiple register running instead of three people figuring out how to charge a bill; not having people run back and forth from register to shoes; check-in station instead of mixing bowling/paying and check-in flows; et al.  But, at least they try to be as pleasant as possible.

The fourth star comes from having a clean, fun, youth-friendly setting.  There truly is no better bowling experience around.  The game and laser tag areas are also cool.  

Visiting Uptown makes for a family-friendly excursion.  Games, frames, and A/C on a hot weekend.  Some minor improvements an they could start averaging four to five stars.

Games are awesome! Customer service in game area awesome! Drinks awesome! Service and management in restaurant/ bar are horrible. Management/ lead in restaurant horrible and servers need to be trained. Be prepared to wait and only see your server 3 times. Don't go for food at all go for bowling and games!

I came here for my work Christmas party and it was really fun! We had the back room with a buffet, bar, and mini bowling alley. The drinks were good as well as the food! I like the dark atmosphere with neon lights. It made the lanes look awesome! The seating was also very comfortable.

This is going to be long but worth the read..
This was my very first time coming to this place and man was I extremely diassapointed. I drove an hour to get here for fun with family just before my birthday. We had a group of 7 people and 3 kids, so we spent a lot of money at this place. Apon arriving, the front counter for bowling was nice and got us everything and set up with our lane. We got to our lane and my sister had just picked up a menu and opened it when I turned and noticed the waitress was standing accross the table staring at her impatiently and annoyed waiting for her to order a drink. I had to mentally question who this person was at first until I realized it was our waitress because she didn't say hi, she didn't introduce herself or say anything except does anyone else want anything to my sister not even asking the other people in my group.
When she came back with the drinks and the first snack my friend ordered, my friend said this doesn't look or taste like it states in the menu. There was supposed to be avocado and chicken, there clearly wasn't and there was peppers in it which was not in the description. The waitress kept coming back with well it's all in there, not asking if they would like to try something else or have them remake it. 
A bit later, we all ordered food. Everything came out about 15-20 minutes later at the same time. I ordered the Cajun chicken pasta, and it was not cheap. When I got it, it looked and even tasted like a tv dinner. I told the waitress i didn't like it and asked if i could get something else. She took the plate, slammed it on the table and said what's wrong with it. I said it tastes like a tv dinner, she said what else do you want. Meanwhile with an attitude and rolling her eyes. She brought my new food, and my sister had recieved a drink that tasted like cough medicine, i thought the same thing. When i asked the waitress for a different because that one was not good, she didn't say a word, took the drink, rolled her eyes and walked away. I sarcastically said thank you and she snarkely said your welcome while walking away. 
After all of that, I saw her talking to employees and they were looking in my direction and laughing. You can't know for sure that they are talking about you, but you can definately feel the energy and vibe from that.

After everything, I asked to speak to a manager, and he came out and when i told him everything he was very apologetic and was asking what he could do to make it better. He offered compensation in some way. 
The only reason this doesn't have one star is because the manager was nice and helpful. I am going to give it one more chance and will write a review for how my second visit goes.

OK, So I have been here 5 times in the last week and a half so I have an update.

Service can improve here.  I did have different customer service from everyone wanting to help to asking several employees to take my order.  

I do enjoy going here, but after seeing the vast variance in customer service I hope everyone that goes here gets the great service all the time.  Great service was when everyone asked if we needed anything, checking back with us throughout are meal, etc.  Different employees, even management checking in and making sure we are enjoying our food and drinks.  

When someone gets the poor service I got I would assume they would not come back here.  I noted 10 minutes before I had to get up and ask for someone to take my order.  I then had to wait another 10 minutes before someone actually helping my group of 6 customers.  It was busy, but I think just acknowledgment makes a difference.  

So between those 2 extremes I hope Uptown Alley can manage a consistant level of customer service.  I did watch several groups of people walk out of the open seating area once they were at that waiting threshold.  Once they noticed no one was going to take their orders they left, loss of business and maybe future business?

I really want Uptown Alley to do well since it is my neighborhood bar, restaurant, entertainment location.  

If you visit uptown Alley please ask for someone to take your order if you are sitting for a while with no help.  The food and drinks are good so please try them before leaving.

Hopefully you come when service is excellent and everyone is asking you how your food and drinks are :)

I enjoyed my visit here. My girl and I came here to bowl. We played a couple of rounds and had a great time. This place is clean and the staff does a good job providing good customer service. Good location, too.

I'll give it 4 mainly because it provides a fun place for both kids and adults in Surprise that has been sorely needed.  

Went with my 7 & 9 year olds today.   We didn't get to do "everything" there because it gets pricey really fast.  That would be my chief complaint, but again, it's the only game in town like this and I am sure the owners know that.

Bowling - was great fun, excellent waitress service right at your lane where you can order food and eat it there.  $4 per person for each game, no discounts for kids (major dislike on that), $3.50 per person for shoes.  

Laser tag is $7 per person on weekends and $5 during the week.  So another $21 for the three of us on top of the $22.50 for bowling.

Arcade is fairly small and you buy tokens that are on a credit card type thing the kids swipe in each game.  It amounts to each game being between $1-$2.50 to play.  This is really price compared to other places like this, and as someone else mentioned the "prizes" at the end of the rainbow with the tickets you get out of the games take way to many and does disappoint.

The restaurant when you come in looks great for watching games.  There is a HUGE screen on one end - we did not eat in there so I can't say much else on it so far.  Same with the over 21 area, although it does look fun and I hope to go back without the kids in the evening sometime.

For some reason there were two uniformed Surprise police officers standing guard in a couple different places inside.  This was odd in my opinion given the clientele on a Sunday afternoon in this area.

Overall we'll be back as a family and I intend to check it out during grown ups time as well.   Just hope the prices don't turn it into a place you have to save up to go as opposed to a casual neighborhood spot to go on any given weekend.

I've been visiting my in-laws here in Surprise for about 12 years now and it doesn't cease to amaze me how much it's grown.

Now that I have kiddies in tow a place like Uptown Alley is definitely welcomed. My first visit was mid-week and right when it opened so it wasn't busy at all and everything was clean and refreshed and service was on point and friendly.

People of Surprise, I don't think ya'll know how spoiled you are with a modern facility like this. I'm from SF but live in HI and believe it or not but a clean, updated, kid friendly and affordable bowling alley with good food and drinks is non-existent in SF and Hawaii. All the bowling alleys are OLD and pricey.  And with the exception of Aiea Bowl (Shout out to Alley Restaurant!) the food is always mediocre. 

This place has automatic scoring and bumper guards that pop up when a kid comes up to bowl!  So then you don't have to get a kids only lane, both kids and adults can bowl at the same time! Sweeeeeet!

I even came back a second time to watch a Niner game as the amount and sizes of TVs in this place are impressive. It was really busy in the bar areas but the service was still good. At any rate bummers others don't like Uptown Alley as much as me, but then again you don't know what you have until you just don't have it! My recap:

Pros:
-Something for everyone: A small lounge area with TVs, a big sports bar area with massive screen and tvs all around, private rooms, small arcade area (which our 3-5 year olds enjoyed). 
-The automatic bumper guards that pop up for every kid that bowled! Sold!
-Really good chips and salsa
-Affordable (well to this Californian Hawaiian it is)
-Lot's of promo nights, like kids bowl free, $2 games etc etc.


Cons:
-Non that I can think of really. Maybe I'll come here on a Friday night or when a band is playing, so it's super busy and I can get irriated like other people. NOT. lol....

I had dinner during happy hour tonight and it was really good (margherita pizza). Everyone in my party seemed to really enjoy their food. We were in a large party and the servers were all very friendly as well. I'm looking forward to returning soon for some bowling with my family.

Horrible!! If this is all Surprise has for kids to do, they need to rethink the future! The laser tag is too small, too many little, little kids get put into groups with bigger kids. Tooooooo much liquor, more to life than drinking. The hotesses are to busy chatting with themselves, or their pals who happen to come in. The bowling is expensive for what it is. (We don't want to help pay your lease). Birthday party's are too expensive for more than a couple of kids. Can't bring your own "Gluten" free anything, no snacks for diabetics in the building allowed as carry in, it's ridiculous.

Worst bowling alley I've ever been to.  I've been here an hour an a half and I'm still waiting to bowl.  Meanwhile they have 8 lanes have said reserved for a party for the last hour.  I could have bowled 3 times over.

Went yesterday to uta and it was great Ryan G, helped us a lot and had great customer service and he even provided us the deal the company offers for laser tag don't.really remember it. But all in all he made it a great experiences for me and my brother and his girlfriend, I well definitely be going back soon because of his services

Stopped in here from Vegas  to Tucson, had dinner and a couple of drinks which were great . A big Ol Hawaiian bar tender helped us. He was very helpful, and friendly!! If you ever stop in have him make you his specialty drink!! I think his name was Dave . The reason why I gave this place 4 out 5 stars was because , I saw the manager treat one of the employees bad in front customers. You can clearly see he is a boss , not a leader!!! Other than that great place!!!

Claudia is an amazing bartender! She was attentive to all our needs and was never rude. She was on point with our drink orders. I would recommend Claudia to anyone looking to have a drink and a good time at uptown ally. If it wasn't for Claudia,  I wouldn't even come to the place. Good job uptown ally for hiring such an outstanding individuals!
Great place to catch happy hour and have a few drinks in a fun environment. Food is pretty good and during the daytime the place is pretty empty.

This is a cool bowling alley with a bar, large game area, live music, restaurant, large TVs and laser tag I think? Games are reasonably priced. I think I paid $30 for unlimited amount of games in an hour or so? Don't even know if that's saving a lot of money if even any but I'll go with it! Only sucky thing is if you're bowling, it takes forever to order drinks and to get them!

do not have your kids birthday party here...... customer service sucks....couldn't find anyone to help and when I did they seemed bothered. No place to open gifts, there was an empty meeting room adjacent to out 3 lanes, when we tried to open the gifts there we were kicked out and the door locked, our party was inconvenienced by having to open gifts on the lanes with a locked empty room 5 feet away, pretty crappy way to treat a party that paid well over $500 for a 9 year olds bday party
Give this man TYLER HALL a raise. Personable, funny, and ready to help clients. Thank you for your hard work. Keep up the good work.

I have been here a couple times, and while I admit it is fun there are a lot of flaws.

First off, it's pretty pricey, if I recall correctly a single beer is like $10 or something like that, don't quote me on that exact price though.

Second of all, the service is lackluster. multiple times now, my friends and I would sit around waiting for our server and they never come. We would go out of our way to find a server and can't find ours, so we just ask the next one we see and they say they're not our server. Also, I've gone to the bar to get water before and the bartender says that our server will get it for us instead of taking 5 extra seconds to fill a cup up with water and handing it to us right there and then.

Overall, I am pretty unhappy with the service I have received here. These occurrences have happened on multiple occasions.

The place was fun with plenty of activities to get into. Def makes up for not having a Dave and Buster's in the west valley. The nachos with salsa and turkey with avocado sandwich could've been better but it also could've been worse. The drinks at the bar and the bar tender provided great service. I would recommend to try at least once and see for yourself.

Its crazy to rate this place just on "Uptown Alley" because there are so many different aspects to this amazing place! :) 

1. Bowling Alley: Love it! They have an "Adult: section to bowl in with its own bar that you can also rent out for parties. Its amazing. Also have bowled in the big lanes and have always had a blast. All the staff is very friendly and service is good except the drink and food service was a bit slow. 

2. Red Embers: Really liked the place. Outside seating with some nice fireplaces for ambience. Inside is noisy no matter where you sit because its right across from the kids arcade. Food was decent, service was good but we were sitting at the bar.

3 Lazer Tag: Its lazer tag! It has an upstairs and downstairs. Lots of kids and also adults playing. Awesome thing about the lazer tag is if you get hit your not out! It takes about a minute before your gun and vest recharge and you get to keep playing. They have teams . Red and blue. On your lazer gun is your "team name". Mine was Falcon.. after the time is up you can look on the big screen outside for your "team" name and see how good you did against everybody that was in the game. also see if red or blue team won. We had a blast!

4. Arcade: Pretty good selection of games. Kind of reminds me of what they have at Peter Piper.

5. Karoke: Seems like everytime Im there they have Karaoke or some kind of band. It happens right in the midst of everything! Its like this little stage that overlooks the bowling lanes, arcade and one of the bars.. lol.. Ya, Its pretty entertaining

All in all I love this place. They do have security everywhere but they have always been super cool. Always have a great time here whatever we are doing.

The bowling was awesome the atmosphere was great but one thing that made my family's experience here perfect was our server Renee. She was very interactive with us as guests and even showed off some of her dance moves ! If you go on Wednesday nights ask for her, I know we always will!

Ah, I both love and hate this place.

This type of entertainment was much needed in the surprise/el mirage area. So expect a wait. 

Great place to go with friends not so much for a family on a budget. Bowling is expensive, food is expensive and I  think the arcade has room for improvement. 
If you bring kids and your bowling game goes past 10 expect an employee to stand there waiting not so patiently for your game to end, so they can remind that kids aren't allowed past a certain time. 

They should really offer families of 5+ special prices without the option of having to call ahead and create a "party event". 

Otherwise just going with friends for a night out is good and fun and seriously laser tag... Is awesome

My department recently held a meeting and team-building event at Uptown Alley. From first contact, the Sales Director was extremely patient and accommodating. She was very personally involved in planning our event and responded to all email and phone-calls promptly.

As for the venue....wow! The service was excellent, and the hospitality exceptional. We started our meeting when the facility opened, but they were already set-up and ready for us. Lunch was served right on time, and the quality and portion size was surprisingly good for the price. Even though there weren't many people on the lanes, the banquet room was a little loud, but still not unbearable.

Once we moved to the lanes for the Teambuilding Part of the morning, they already had our names loaded and our shoes staged at the appropriate lanes!

This is an unbelievably enormous place, with something for everyone. 

My personal thanks to Ashley, Becca, Chris, Patrick, and Martha; you guys did an awesome job and we'll definitely encourage our other departments to use your venue for their next outing!

Great place!!! Took my son here for his 7th birthday and he had a blast! Friendly staff, the place was very clean!!! Laser tag was awesome I think that was his favorite part! Food was well priced! We recommend friends family anyone who wants to have a good time to this location!

Been frequenting uptown alley for about two years now. Service is usually pretty decent, but tonight it is terrible. How terrible you ask? Enough for me to write a review. The dining area, as always, had great service but the bowling area was terrible. Waited at the bar for 3 minutes with no one show up. Made it all the way to the 7th frame and my friend flagged a waitress down. I gave her my order and she asked who was my waitress. I said no one. Smh. I'll most likely be back cause I'm not driving all the way to main event. They win by default tonight.leta see how long my order takes to come out tonight
Nothing says it's the holidays like a long wait so you can enjoy terrible service! Empty glasses on the table and service help that's too busy talking to each other does not equal a big tip!

awful management - rude to their emplyees in front of customers.  was greeted by a pitete friendly and smiley lady who was fantasticly helpful.  later saw "management" yelling at her for no reason other than apparent power /ego trip.  if they continue to treat their workers this way - they'll loose the good ones and the place will go outta business quickly.  also, refuse to allow customers to bring in water! this is AZ- one can dehydrate... just wanna make an extra buck off poor customer at this overpriced fad.

Well, we've been coming here countless times, it's super close to our house, in fact we can just walk our way if we want to exercise! LOL. Both my hubby and I are not really into "sports" , well I mean I love to watch basketball or boxing...let me give you a clue if what country I am from? Manny Pacquiao is the country's  boxing legend! hehe 
I am from the Philippines So those two sports are mainly the nation's fave! I'm an avid fan, I watch
BUT I don't play! LOL. ^_^
It's so happened that my hubby is the same, I mean he would watch if it's Pacquiao or Mc. Gregor's fight! and that's about it! haha
If there's one sport, that we both would play...it's BOWLING! Like what I said, we are NOT sporty, but if invited by a friend or when we feel like it..bowling is the ONLY sports we would dare to play! We are both 
"trying harders"! LOL But, you'll be surprised, 
we can absolutely do "STRIKES"!!! Oh yeah! haha 
I'm telling you, don't dare us! hehe we may not be PROS but if challenged to give our best shot, we might beat you! ROFL! ^_^
Okay, let's focus on this place's review hehe, uhhmm it's  a fun place to go...that's why I'm giving them 5 stars. I am not hard to please guys! Give me good service and a place that's worth not just the money but a time enjoyably spent, then I'll definitely flatter you! haha
This place never fails my expectations. Good place to hangout. We don't drink, just soda and juice haha... I don't mind the crowd, it makes it more fun! 
The food is always good, and I love the lively spirit too especially the music that always makes me wanna dance while playing! LOL.
Keep it up guys!!! We'll definitely would come back!

The facilities are nice but the service continues to be horrendous. Last week, my wife and I bowled in the 22 and over section. The waitress came and got our order and, to start, we asked for an iced tea and a club soda. If you live in the area you know that the water here tastes terrible unless you filter it. I am not sure whether the water is not filtered here or if perhaps the water in the ice machine isn't but the club soda was terrible. I waited for the waitress to come back to ask for something different and after 40 minutes I walked to the bar and did it myself. Prior to bowling we ate at their restaurant; the food was pretty good but again, the service lacked. In this case the problem is the staffing, or lack there of. We were told that we would have a 15-20 wait when there were over 10 tables open. Luckily the manager approached the hostess and had us seated but something was said about creating a longer wait time for the following customers because they didn't have enough servers. This experience is not my first one like this, in fact it seems to be the norm, unfortunately. In the last 3 months I bowled by myself in the afternoon. Both times I was given a lane inside the 21+ area and was given the name of the server. Both times I made my first game last about 30 minutes as I waited for her. I started the second game and... You guessed it; I finished it without anyone ever coming over to see if I needed anything. There were 2 other parties there as well in both occasions and nobody received any service. To the management: WAKE UP!!!! Your lack of leadership and ability to keep your establishment staffed properly, apparently based on poor pay and employee treatment (based on comments made  by some of you current and ex members of your team). Perhaps you rely on the fact that you are the only place of this kind in the area but from now on, I am driving somewhere else.

This place is okay if this is your thing. It reminds me of those big game rooms they have in Laughlin or Vegas for the kiddies to enjoy while parent gamble. At this place they do have an over 21 Room but it was booked for a private party last night. Instead, we played darts and watched the hockey game in the mini lounge. 

They have pool tables, darts, game room, Laser tag, and bowling. They have a bar and a restaurant. 

I gave this three stars instead of four for a specific reason. I was highly annoyed at the bar. After standing there for 15 minutes I was pretty much ignored for about ten minutes. I was then overcharged for an already overpriced too expensive drink. Then to top it off, the drink had no alcohol in it. ( Or very little) and the glass was only 3/4 filled. The bathroom was just ridiculously disgusting. No soap, the water did not work in any of the spouts and no TP. It was so dirty.
